charges are applicable.Click hereto know more.Minimal DocumentationThese loans have simple paperwork and quick processingDocument Required for Personal Loan for Home RenovationSalaried IndividualsSelf Employed IndividualsIndian citizens aged between 20-58 years can apply for this loan.Proof of identity and residenceLatest 3 months' bank statement (where the salary / income is credited)Salary slips for the last 3 monthsPAN Card and Adhaar CardProof of identity and residenceIncome proof (audited financials for the last 2 years)Latest 6 months’ bank statementOffice address proofProof of residence or office ownershipProof of continuity of business.How to Apply?WebsiteiMobileEnter your desire loan amountProvide your basic personal and work-related informationReview your loan amount and tenureConfirm your loan applicationGet the loan disbursedAPPLY NOWStep 1: Download iMobile and log in using your MPIN or fingerprintStep 2: Navigate to ‘Get Instant Loan’ and click on 'Apply now' in the Personal Loan sectionStep 3: Enter your required loan amountStep 4: Validate all the details of your loanStep 5: Accept the Terms and Conditions by checking the box and click on ‘Disburse Now’Step 6: Authenticate through Aadhaar-based eSign and then click on ‘Submit’Personal Loan for Home Renovation FAQ’sIs there a loan available for home renovation?Yes, ICICI Bank offers Personal Loan for Home Renovation   specifically aimed at home remodelling, repairs and upgrades.What is a Personal Loan for Home Renovation?A Personal Loan for Home Renovation is a Personal Loan by ICICI Bank intended to finance home upgrades, repairs and remodelling. With loan amounts up to ₹50 lakh and flexible repayment terms, it is the perfect solution for enhancing your home without financial strain.Who is eligible for this loan?To be eligible, the applicant must be an Indian citizen in the age group of 20-58 years, with a minimum monthly income of ₹ 30,000. The minimum salary requirement will differ depending on the profile of the applicant – for example: the type of employer, whether the applicant has an existing relationship with ICICI Bank etc.Why choose ICICI Bank for this loan?ICICI Bank offers attractive interest rates, flexible repayment options and a hassle-free application process.What is the repayment tenure?The loan tenure ranges from 12 to 72 months, allowing borrowers to select a plan that suits their financial capabilities.How much loan can I get?You can get a loan ranging from ₹ 50,000 to ₹ 50 lakh, depending on your income, credit history.Click hereto check your eligibility.What is the rate of interest for this loan?ICICI Bank offers attractive interest rates based on your credit profile and repayment tenure. Specific rates can be discussed with the Bank's representatives.Is any collateral required for this loan?No, ICICI Bank Home Renovation Loans do not require any collateral. Therefore, no security or guarantor is required.BlogsBlogsgoto previous cardgoto next cardgoto previous cardgoto next cardCloseLooking for something else?Salary OverdraftInstant Personal LoanPersonal Loan On Credit Cardclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

loan solutions to achieve your business goalsHome ImprovementLoanFund your home renovations with our flexible loan optionsAbout Loan Against Property (LAP)Types of Loan Against PropertyICICI Bank offers customised Loan Against Property options, including loans against residential, commercial and industrial properties.Customised LAP SolutionsWe offer Loans Against Property with competitive interest rates, ensuring financial flexibility.Hassle-Free Loan ProcessWe prioritise customer convenience with a simplified application process, quick approvals and complete transparency, making borrowing easy and efficient.Extensive Network of ICICI BankWith a strong presence across India and robust digital banking platforms, ICICI Bank ensures seamless support and accessibility for all customers.Loan Against Property FAQsWhat is a Loan Against Property (LAP)?Loan Against Property (LAP) is a secured loan where you can pledge your residential, commercial or industrial property as collateral to borrow funds. The Loan amount is typically a percentage of the property's market value.Who can take a Loan Against Property (LAP)?Individuals, including salaried professionals, self-employed individuals and business owners, can apply for a Loan Against Property. Eligibility depends on factors such as income, age, property type and credit score.What is the maximum term for which I can take a Loan Against Property (LAP)?You can avail of a Loan Against Property for a maximum tenure of up to 15 years. However, the tenure offered may vary depending on factors such as your repayment capacity, age and the Bank’s policies.What type of property can I mortgage for a Loan Against Property?You can mortgage residential, commercial or industrial properties. The property must be owned by the applicant and should meet ICICI Bank’s eligibility criteria.Does ICICI Bank offer a Property Loan as an overdraft?Yes, ICICI Bank offers an overdraft facility under Loan Against Property, allowing you to withdraw funds as needed and pay interest only on the utilised amount.What percentage of the property value can I avail as a Loan Against Property?You can avail a maximum of up to 75% of the property’s market value as a Loan Against Property, depending on factors such as the property type and your eligibility.BlogsBlogsgoto previous cardgoto next cardgoto previous cardgoto next cardCloseclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI Bank
content: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI BankLoansHome LoanService ChargesFees And Service ChargesICICI Bank ensures that you get the best Loans in terms ofinterest ratesand other facilities. You can choose from Adjustable, Fixed or Floating Rate Loan.SMS HOME TO 5676766APPLY NOWChargesMortgage LoansLoan Processing Charges (Non Refundable)Upto 2% of loan amount.The processing/login fee is a one-timenon refundablefee and is collected by the Bank for the purpose of appraising the Application for the Facility and the same is independent of the outcome/result of such appraisal. The processing/login fee is payable at the time of submitting of the Application, by way of Cheque/Demand Draft favoring the Bank and/or such other mode as may be acceptable to the Bank.Administrative Charges0.25 % of Facility Amount or ₹ 5000/- whichever is lower.(The Administrative charges are a one-timenon-refundablecharges collected by the Lender for the purpose of appraising the valuation and legal verification of property to ascertain suitability of accepting the property for mortgage and the same is independent of the outcome /result of such appraisal. Please note that the administrative charges are payable at the time of disbursement of the Facility)Commitment charges / Non utilisation fee (Applicable for Overdraft Facility)Minimum 30% utilization required on a quarterly average basis. Charge of 0.5% will be levied on the deficit amount*.* Not applicable for salaried customersPart Prepayment FeesNilPrepayment Charges1. For the Facility with Fixed Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:2% on Home loan, Home improvement loan, Land loan and Top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.4% on Non-home loan (i.e. Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards Prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.Nil Prepayment charges on fixed rate loans if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Small or Micro & Loan amount is less than or equal to ₹ 50 lacs.2. For the Facility with Adjustable Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:Nil prepayment charges on home loan, home improvement loan and land loanNil prepayment charges on top up on home loan where the Borrower(s) is individual and the end use of the loan facility is other than business purpose.2% on top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to Non-Individual Borrower(s) for all-purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Non-home loan (Loan against property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance , Overdraft) where loan is given to Individual Borrower(s) and the end use of the Facility is other than business purpose.4% on Non-home loan (Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to non-individual Borrower(s) for all purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Money Saver Account.Conversion chargesFor all floating (adjustable) rate linked term loan to Fixed or floating (adjustable) ₹ 3,000.Semi Fixed / Fixed Interest Rate to Adjustable Interest Rate - 2% of the principal outstandingFor Overdraft - 0.5% of the principal outstandingCheque/ECS/NACH dishonor Charges, per transaction₹ 500/- charges per bounce/return/dishonor of cheques and /or any payment instruction including AD / ECS / NEFT / E-Cheque or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Cheque/Repayment mode swap charges₹ 500/-Penal Charges in the event of default/delay in payment/repayment of any part of the loan amount on due datePenal Charges shall be equal to 5% per annum on the overdue sum from the due date to the actual payment date plus applicable taxes or other statutory levies, if any.Charges for Amortisation Schedule₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for Statement of account₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for prepayment statement₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for duplicate NOC/No Dues Certificate₹ 250/-Charge for revalidation of no objection certificate₹ 250/-Penal charges for non-submission of the post disbursement documents₹ 5000/- per month (will be levied from the day the document is due till the same is not submitted)Penal charges for non-collection of property documents post 60 days from the loan closure date₹ 1,000/- Every month charges will be levied till collection of documents.Penal Charges for breach of construction timelineIn case of land loan, the Borrower(s) shall complete the construction of the house within 4 years. If the construction of the house is not completed within 4 years from the first disbursement date the Borrower shall be liable to pay Penal Charges as under -1% annually on the principal outstanding or ₹ 50,000/- whichever is lower or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Penal Charges will be levied every year after 4 years till the construction is completed.Renewal Fees (Applicable for Overdraft Product)₹ 5,000/-Not applicable for Money Saver and Insta OD.Loan / Property Document Retreival Charges₹ 500/-Cash Transaction Charges (for repayment of EMI due in cash at branches)₹ 100/-Information utility charges (Only for corporate cases)₹ 300/-Non-refundable charges under Central Registry of Securitization Asset Reconstruction and Security Interest of India (CERSAI)₹ 50/- (For loan upto 5L)₹ 100/- (For loan above 5L)Auction charges for repossessed assetAt ActualsCharges incurred in filing legal suitAt ActualsCharges incurred in SARFAESI proceedingsAt ActualsEnforcement chargesAt ActualsNon Maintenance of Mode of Payment charges (NMMP)₹ 800/-Paper advertisement chargesAt ActualsProfessional charges (Advocate Charges/Retainer ship Charges)At ActualsRepossession chargesAt ActualsSecurity guard chargesAt ActualsNoteGoods & Service Tax and other taxes, levies, etc. applicable as per prevailing rate will be charged over and above these chargesPlease Note:Time frame for Disposal of Loan Application Form (MSE Borrower) is as below:(from the date of receipt, provided your application is complete in all respects and is accompanied by documents as per 'check list' provided)Up to ₹ 25 lakhwithin 14 working daysAbove ₹ 25 lakhwithin 6 weeksAPPLY NOWclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Home Loan Interest Rates @7.70%* (2025) | ICICI Bank
content: Home Loan Interest Rates @7.70%* (2025) | ICICI BankLoansHome LoanInterest RateHome Loan Interest Rates - August 2025Buy your dream home with ICICI Bank's attractive Home Loan offers! Choose between floating and fixed interest rates as per your needs. Get a Home Loan up to ₹ 5 Crore* with minimal documentation and step into your new home sooner.Customers with an Instant Home Loan can get online sanction of their Home Loan at a rate of interest of 7.70%* p.a.*T&Cs apply. Rate of interest is subject to bureau score and applicable for Instant Home Loans through the digital platform / journey.APPLY NOWRepo Rate effective June 7th, 2025 – 5.50%Special Home Loan RatesGet customised Home Loan rates tailored to your credit score. Enjoy personalised lending options that fit your financial needs.Credit ScoreSalaried CustomersSelf-Employed Customers8008.75%8.75%750 – 8008.75%8.85%The above-mentioned interest rates are linked to the repo rate and will be valid till 31st August, 2025.Standard Home Loan Interest RateICICI Bank offers Home Loans with standard interest rates that cater to your financial needs. Our tiered loan slabs ensure that home financing is convenient and accessible, supporting a diverse range of borrowers.Loan SlabSalaried CustomersSelf-Employed CustomersUp to ₹ 35 lakh8.75% - 9.40%8.75% - 9.55%₹ 35 lakh to ₹ 75 lakh8.75% - 9.55%8.75% - 9.70%Above ₹ 75 lakh8.75% - 9.65%8.750% -9.80%The interest rates mentioned above for Home Loans vary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.All the interest rates mentioned above are linked to the repo rateThe processing fee is 0.5% of the loan amount + applicable taxesThe above-mentioned interest rates are valid till 31st August, 2025.Fixed Home Loan Interest RatesLooking for stability in your Home Loan payments? ICICI Bank’s fixed Home Loan interest rates offer just that. Lock in your interest rate for the entire loan tenure and enjoy predictable EMIs throughout..Fixed TenureRate of Interest24 Months Fixed8.85%37 Months Fixed8.65%-8.80%60 Months Fixed120 Months Fixed10.75%-11.80%Full Term Fixed10.90%-11.20%The interest rates mentioned above forHome Loansvary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.The interest rates for fixed home loans will be valid till 31st August, 2025.Interest Rates for Non-Housing Loans: Loan Against Property/Non-Residential Premises/Lease Rental DiscountingLoan SlabSalaried/ Self-Employed (PSL)Self-Employed (Non-PSL)Up to ₹ 50 lakh11.10%-11.75%11.60%-12.25%₹ 50 lakh to ₹ 100 lakh10.85%-11.50%11.35%-12.00%Above ₹ 100 lakh10.60%-11.25%11.10%-11.75%The interest rates mentioned above vary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.All the interest rates mentioned above are linked to the repo rateThe above-mentioned interest rates are valid till 31st August, 2025.FAQs on Home Loan Interest RatesWhat is a Home Loan interest rate?The interest rate on a Home Loan is the percentage charged as interest by the lender on the total amount an individual borrows to buy or refinance a residential property.What are the current Home Loan interest rates offered by ICICI Bank?The current Home Loan interest rates offered by ICICI Bank can be checked in the table given above.How can the interest rate of a Home Loan be reduced?The interest rate of home loan depends on multiple factors such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc. Customers can also compare interest rates offered by different banks and can transfer their existing loan to a favourable lender, if applicable.Which interest rate is known as the perfect option?Different types of interest rates are suitable for different customers. You can clickhereto see the various interest rates offered by ICICI Bank on Home Loans.How does the EMI for a Home Loan get calculated?The EMI of a Home Loan is calculated basis the loan amount, the applicable rate of interest and the loan duration (tenure). You can visitthispage to know more.What are the interest rates charged on the Home Loans?ICICI Bank provides competitive interest rates on Home Loans which are linked to the repo rate published by the RBI. You can check the current interest rates for Home Loans at the beginning of this page.Are there any other factors that determine the interest rates on Home Loans?Yes. Factors like credit score play a crucial role in deciding the interest rate that an individual pays on their Home Loan.How can I find out the EMI amount for a specific Home Loan?All applicants can easily find out the EMI amount by using our Home Loan EMI Calculator. To use the calculator, you must provide the interest rate, tenure and loan amount and you will be shown the interest payable and EMI amount instantly.What are the types of Home Loan interest rates?The choice of interest rate can greatly affect your home loan EMIs. Here are the two main types:1. Floating Interest Rate:This rate varies with market conditions, offering potential savings but also carries the risk of the rate being increased. This is suitable for customers who can handle uncertainty.2. Fixed Interest Rate:A fixed interest rates provides stability, ensuring consistent EMIs throughout the loan term, making budgeting easier.How are interest payments calculated?Interest payments are calculated using the below methods:1. Flat Interest Rate:Calculates interest on the full loan amount for the entire loan term, leading to higher total interest costs.2. Reducing Balance Method:Interest is calculated on the remaining principal balance. As you repay, the interest may increase or decrease, affecting the overall loan cost.What aspects can affect the rate of interest on home loans?Below are some important aspects that are considered when deciding the Home Loan interest rate:Credit Score:All lenders consider the loan applicant's credit score. People with a higher credit score are more likely to be eligible for a higher Home LoanLTV (Loan to Value) Ratio:This is the proportion of the loan amount that goes towards the home's appraised valueEconomic Conditions:Broader economic aspects such as central bank policies, market trends and inflation can impact interest ratesBorrower’s Debt-To-Income Ratio:All lenders check the borrower’s debt and income levels to determine their repayment capacity and accordingly, the interest rate.How can I save on my Home Loan interest payment?Make additional repayments:When you make extra repayments towards the principal amount, you reduce the outstanding loan amount and consequently, the interest to be paidChoose a shorter loan duration:Opting for a loan with a shorter duration (tenure) will result in higher monthly payments but lower interest payoutNegotiate with the lender:If applicable, you should negotiate with the lender to obtain a lower interest rate.How do I check the overall interest payout of the Home Loan?To calculate the overall interest payout for the Home Loan, use the online Home Loan Calculator offered by ICICI Bank.  Provide the tenure, interest rate and loan amount to check the interest you must pay during the loan term.What are the various kinds of interest rates for housing loans?ICICI Bank provides interest rates on housing loans that are classified as ‘fixed’, ‘standard’, and ‘special’. The fixed option guarantees that the interest rate will stay constant throughout the loan duration.close disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

The Loan amount is typically a percentage of the property's market value.Who can take a Loan Against Property (LAP)?Individuals, including salaried professionals, self-employed individuals and business owners, can apply for a Loan Against Property. title: Documents Required for Mortgage Loan | Loan Against Property 2025
content: Documents Required for Mortgage Loan | Loan Against Property 2025LoansHome LoanLoan Against PropertyDocumentsDocuments Required for Loan Against PropertyAPPLY NOWBelow is the list of documents required for a Mortgage Loan based on profile:Individuals:Identity Proof & Address Proof of Individuals: Aadhaar/Passport/Driving License/Voter ID/National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (NREGA) Card/Letter from the National Population Register (NPR) containing details of your name and address.DOB Proof: Passport/Driving License/Voter ID/NREGA Card/Letter from the NPR containing details of your name and address.Non-Individuals (Entity):Identity Proof: Registration Certificate including Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) issued by the Government/Certificate/License issued by the municipal authorities under Shop and Establishment Act/Sales and Income Tax returns/CST/VAT/GST Certificate/Certificate/Registration document issued by Sales Tax/Service Tax/Professional Tax authorities/ IEC (Importer Exporter Code) issued to the proprietary concern by the office of the Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT)/License/Certificate of practice issued in the name of the proprietary concern by any professional body incorporated under a statute/Complete Income Tax Returns (not just the acknowledgement) in the name of the Sole Proprietor where the firm's income is reflecting, duly authenticated/acknowledged by the Income Tax authorities/Utility bills such as electricity, water, landline telephone bills etc.Note: For sole proprietorship concerns, any of the above-mentioned two documents are required.Address Proof: GST Certificate/Business Registration Certificate/Gumastaa License/Udhyam Registration Certificate/Bank statement (not to be considered for entity proof)/Utility Bill/ITR/Rent Agreement with utility bill within 2 months.Note: If the registered address and permanent address of the entity are different – proof is required in both cases.Apart from the above-mentioned document, additional documents will be required for the below entities:Partnership Firm: Partnership DeedLimited Liability Partnership: LLP Agreement and Certificate of Incorporation, List of designated partners and latest profit-sharing ratio certified by a Chartered Accountant (CA)/Company Secretary (CS)Public & Private Limited Co. (Even if there is only 1 director): Certificate of Incorporation, Memorandum of Association (MOA) and Articles of Association (AOA), CA/CS certified latest list of Directors and Shareholders with their names, date of birth, nationality and addressTrust: Trust Deed with Registration Certificate, list of all beneficiaries, trustees, settlors, protectors and authors of the trust, containing their names and Date of BirthSociety: By-laws/Memorandum of a Society with Registration Certificate, list of members with their names, address and Date of BirthHUF: List of Adult Coparceners (Joint Heirs) attested by the Karta (Head of the family)Authorised signatory along with KYC and Relationship Segment details in case of Private/Public Limited Companies/Limited Liability Partnerships/Partnership Firms/Trust/SocietyList of Directors and Senior Management details in case of Private/Public Limited CompaniesLegal Entity Identifier (LEI) Certificate of non-individual borrowers having a banking system exposure of ₹ <5> crore and above.Beneficial owner details along with KYC documents as per below:In case of Company/Partnership Firms/Limited Liability Partnership, more than 10% of shares/capital/profit of the companyIn case of Unincorporated Association or Body of Person/Individual, more than 15% of capital/profit of the companyIn case of author of the trust, the trustee, the beneficiaries with 10% and more interest in the trust.Below is the list of documents required for a Mortgage Loan based on employment:Income Proof:Salaried:Latest Form 16Latest one-month salary slipBank statements of the last 6 months.Self-EmployedLast 6 months’ Bank statements of all operative accountsLast 2 years CA Certified/Audited Income Tax Returns (ITR), computation of income, Profit and Loss Account Statement and Balance sheetGST returns of the last 1 year.Disclaimer This is an indicative list only. Additional documents may be required for a case-to-case basis.close disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Mortgage Loan Calculator: Loan Against Property Calculator Online
content: Mortgage Loan Calculator: Loan Against Property Calculator OnlineLoansHome LoanLoan Against PropertyMortgage Loan CalculatorSimplify Your Financial PlanningICICI Bank’s Loan Against Property EMI Calculator helps you calculate monthly instalments for your property loan with ease.About Loan Against Property EMI CalculatorWhat is a Loan Against Property EMI Calculator?It’s a tool provided by ICICI Bank to calculate your monthly instalments based on your loan amount, interest rate and tenure. It simplifies your financial planning and makes sure you choose a loan amount and tenure that suit your budget.How do you use ICICI Bank’s Loan Against Property EMI Calculator?Enter the loan amount, interest rate and tenure in the calculator. It instantly shows your estimated EMI and the breakdown of total payable amount into principal and payable interest.How can the Loan Against Property EMI Calculator help in financial planning?The calculator provides an estimate of your monthly EMI and total repayment amount. This helps you plan your finances better by making sure that the loan fits within your budget, avoiding any strain on your monthly budget.FAQsCan I use the Loan Against Property EMI Calculator to adjust my loan tenure?Yes, the calculator provides you with options to experiment with tenures. You can adjust the tenure to see the impact on EMI. The higher the tenure, the lower the EMIs but greater will be the total interest, whereas shorter tenures will result in lesser interest but increased EMI.Does the calculator consider floating interest rates?Yes, the calculator considers the floating rate of interest rate for calculation. If you have a floating rate loan, then the actual EMI may vary depending on the interest rate changes over the tenure.Can the EMI Calculator help me decide on pre-payment?Yes, you can see how it impacts your EMI and total repayment if you enter a reduced principal amount after a pre-payment. This helps you decide whether pre-paying is a good financial decision.Is the Loan Against Property EMI Calculator accurate?The calculator provides highly accurate estimates based on the values you enter. However, the actual loan offer may vary slightly depending on factors like processing fees and your credit profile.Can I save the results from the calculator for future reference?No, the calculator does not save your results. You can note down the EMI, total interest and principal details for future reference. Alternatively, you can recalculate anytime by entering the same inputs in the calculator.Terms and conditions apply. Interest rates and charges are subject to periodic revisions. Please verify the latest details before applying.BlogsBlogsgoto previous cardgoto next cardgoto previous cardgoto next cardCloseclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

                                     typePlease enter valid pincodeSUBMITThank you for your request.Your reference number isCRM 786578956Our executive will contact you shortlySorry! Please check back in a few minutes as an error has occurred.Give Wings To Your Business, With ICICI Bank’s CGTMSE Loans.With ICICI Bank’s CGTMSE Loans, you can finance your business with an enhancement, up to Rs 2 crore and extended tenures of up to 10 years.CGTMSE LOANSFinance your business with ICICI Bank’s Credit Guarantee Fund Trust, for Micro and Small Enterprises (CGTMSE) Loans.The Government of India and the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises have jointly launched a Guarantee scheme, to offer credit to Micro and Small Enterprises. This guarantee is provided by a trust fund called the Credit Guarantee Fund Trust for Micro and Small Enterprises (CGTMSE), which is set up by the Government of India and the Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI).CGTMSE is a Hybrid Security product, where ICICI Bank offers a combination ofSecured and Unsecured Loans. The Unsecured Loan would be the portion that is not covered by the collateral security. This loan is offered to the Micro and Small Enterprises that are registered with Udyam or Udhyog Aadhar. All entities, except for the Education Institutes, Agriculture, Self Help Groups, and Training Institutes, are eligible to avail this Guarantee Backed Loan.It allows the customer to avail a collateral-free loan, up to Rs 2 crore, for a tenure of up to 10 years.For details, give us a missed call on 9022499400.Prominent features of the CGTMSE LoanTotal Loan Amount: Up to Rs 7 croreAdditional Unsecured Loan: Loan up to Rs 2 crore over the base loanLong Tenure: Tenure of up to 10 yearsProperty Type: Avail against residential or commercial property.Enhancement of up to Rs 2 croreTotal Loan Amount: Up to Rs 7 croreAdditional Unsecured Loan: Loan up to Rs 2 crore over the base loanLong Tenure: Tenure of up to 10 yearsProperty Type: Avail against residential or commercial property.Enhancement of up to Rs 2 croreTotal Loan Amount: Up to Rs 7 croreAdditional Unsecured Loan: Loan up to Rs 2 crore over the base loanLong Tenure: Tenure of up to 10 yearsProperty Type: Avail against residential or commercial property.PRODUCT SUITEANNUAL GUARANTEE FEEICICI Bank offers a variety of products under the CGTMSE Loans portfolio. If you are an entity eligible for the CGTMSE scheme, you can apply for any of the products mentioned below.Non-Residential Premise LoanBalance TransferInterest Rates on the CGTMSE LoanThe CGTMSE Loan interest rate offered by ICICI Bank to the borrowers is dependent on the evaluation of various factors, such as the borrower’s profile, project cost, and business needs. As compared to other direct loans, the interest rate on CGTMSE Loan is typically low.Eligibility criteria for the CGTMSE SchemeAs per ICICI Bank, the CGTMSE Scheme eligibility, comprises of the following entities:Sole Proprietorship firmsPartnership firmsPrivate Limited CompaniesPublic Limited CompaniesMicro and Small Enterprises, excluding Educational Institutes, Agriculture, Self Help Groups, and Training Institutes.The CGTMSE Loan limit is decided on the basis of the applicant’s profile and business needs.Apart from the interest rate, a borrower is required to pay an additional CGTMSE Guarantee and Service related CGTMSE Fee, while borrowing the loan. For the collateral-free portion of the loan (unsecured loan), the Annual Guarantee Fees, as mentioned below, would be applicable:Facility AmountAnnual Guarantee Fee (AGF) [% p.a.]*Women, Micro Enterprises and Units covered in North East RegionOthersAbove Rs 10 lakh and up to Rs 50 lakh.1.35%1.50%Above Rs 50 lakh and up to Rs 200 lakh1.80%Retail Trader (Above Rs 10 lakh and up to Rs 100 lakh)2.00%*The Annual Guarantee Fee (AGF) would be charged on the guaranteed amount for the first year, and on the outstanding amount for the remaining tenure of the credit facility.Popular FAQsExpand All|Collapse AllWhat is a CGTMSE Loan?CGTMSE is a trust fund that provides a guarantee against the Unsecured Loan, given by the financial institutions to Micro and Small Enterprises.Who can avail a CGTMSE Loan?Micro and Small Enterprises (except for Educational Institutes, Agriculture, Self Help Groups, and Training Institutes) can avail of this loan. Sole Proprietorship firms, Partnership firms, Private Limited Companies, and Public Limited Companies can also avail of a CGTMSE Loan.What facilities are offered under the CGTMSE Loan?Under the CGTMSE Scheme, you can avail a:Collateral Free Loan of up to Rs crore, under the CGTMSE schemeA Term Loan for meeting working capital or business expansion requirements.What is the Loan tenure under the CGTMSE Loan?The loan tenure under the CGTMSE Loan is up to 10 years.Are fraud/wilful default accounts eligible under this scheme?Accounts declared as fraud/wilful defaulters are not considered under the scheme.Is any annual fee applicable against the Unsecured Guaranteed Loan?Yes, an annual fee is applicable for all Unsecured Loans, which are backed by CGTMSE.Can the loan under this product be availed as an Overdraft facility?No, this product is only offered as a Term Loan. Overdraft facility is not allowed under this scheme.Terms and Conditions apply.

Our tiered loan slabs ensure that home financing is convenient and accessible, supporting a diverse range of borrowers.Loan SlabSalaried CustomersSelf-Employed CustomersUp to ₹ 35 lakh8.75% - 9.40%8.75% - 9.55%₹ 35 lakh to ₹ 75 lakh8.75% - 9.55%8.75% - 9.70%Above ₹ 75 lakh8.75% - 9.65%8.750% -9.80%The interest rates mentioned above for Home Loans vary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.All the interest rates mentioned above are linked to the repo rateThe processing fee is 0.5% of the loan amount + applicable taxesThe above-mentioned interest rates are valid till 31st August, 2025.Fixed Home Loan Interest RatesLooking for stability in your Home Loan payments? ICICI Bank’s fixed Home Loan interest rates offer just that. Lock in your interest rate for the entire loan tenure and enjoy predictable EMIs throughout..Fixed TenureRate of Interest24 Months Fixed8.85%37 Months Fixed8.65%-8.80%60 Months Fixed120 Months Fixed10.75%-11.80%Full Term Fixed10.90%-11.20%The interest rates mentioned above forHome Loansvary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.The interest rates for fixed home loans will be valid till 31st August, 2025.Interest Rates for Non-Housing Loans: Loan Against Property/Non-Residential Premises/Lease Rental DiscountingLoan SlabSalaried/ Self-Employed (PSL)Self-Employed (Non-PSL)Up to ₹ 50 lakh11.10%-11.75%11.60%-12.25%₹ 50 lakh to ₹ 100 lakh10.85%-11.50%11.35%-12.00%Above ₹ 100 lakh10.60%-11.25%11.10%-11.75%The interest rates mentioned above vary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.All the interest rates mentioned above are linked to the repo rateThe above-mentioned interest rates are valid till 31st August, 2025.FAQs on Home Loan Interest RatesWhat is a Home Loan interest rate?The interest rate on a Home Loan is the percentage charged as interest by the lender on the total amount an individual borrows to buy or refinance a residential property.What are the current Home Loan interest rates offered by ICICI Bank?The current Home Loan interest rates offered by ICICI Bank can be checked in the table given above.How can the interest rate of a Home Loan be reduced?The interest rate of home loan depends on multiple factors such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc. Customers can also compare interest rates offered by different banks and can transfer their existing loan to a favourable lender, if applicable.Which interest rate is known as the perfect option?Different types of interest rates are suitable for different customers. You can clickhereto see the various interest rates offered by ICICI Bank on Home Loans.How does the EMI for a Home Loan get calculated?The EMI of a Home Loan is calculated basis the loan amount, the applicable rate of interest and the loan duration (tenure). You can visitthispage to know more.What are the interest rates charged on the Home Loans?ICICI Bank provides competitive interest rates on Home Loans which are linked to the repo rate published by the RBI. You can check the current interest rates for Home Loans at the beginning of this page.Are there any other factors that determine the interest rates on Home Loans?Yes. Factors like credit score play a crucial role in deciding the interest rate that an individual pays on their Home Loan.How can I find out the EMI amount for a specific Home Loan?All applicants can easily find out the EMI amount by using our Home Loan EMI Calculator. To use the calculator, you must provide the interest rate, tenure and loan amount and you will be shown the interest payable and EMI amount instantly.What are the types of Home Loan interest rates?The choice of interest rate can greatly affect your home loan EMIs. Here are the two main types:1. Floating Interest Rate:This rate varies with market conditions, offering potential savings but also carries the risk of the rate being increased. This is suitable for customers who can handle uncertainty.2. Fixed Interest Rate:A fixed interest rates provides stability, ensuring consistent EMIs throughout the loan term, making budgeting easier.How are interest payments calculated?Interest payments are calculated using the below methods:1. Flat Interest Rate:Calculates interest on the full loan amount for the entire loan term, leading to higher total interest costs.2. Reducing Balance Method:Interest is calculated on the remaining principal balance. As you repay, the interest may increase or decrease, affecting the overall loan cost.What aspects can affect the rate of interest on home loans?Below are some important aspects that are considered when deciding the Home Loan interest rate:Credit Score:All lenders consider the loan applicant's credit score. People with a higher credit score are more likely to be eligible for a higher Home LoanLTV (Loan to Value) Ratio:This is the proportion of the loan amount that goes towards the home's appraised valueEconomic Conditions:Broader economic aspects such as central bank policies, market trends and inflation can impact interest ratesBorrower’s Debt-To-Income Ratio:All lenders check the borrower’s debt and income levels to determine their repayment capacity and accordingly, the interest rate.How can I save on my Home Loan interest payment?Make additional repayments:When you make extra repayments towards the principal amount, you reduce the outstanding loan amount and consequently, the interest to be paidChoose a shorter loan duration:Opting for a loan with a shorter duration (tenure) will result in higher monthly payments but lower interest payoutNegotiate with the lender:If applicable, you should negotiate with the lender to obtain a lower interest rate.How do I check the overall interest payout of the Home Loan?To calculate the overall interest payout for the Home Loan, use the online Home Loan Calculator offered by ICICI Bank.  Provide the tenure, interest rate and loan amount to check the interest you must pay during the loan term.What are the various kinds of interest rates for housing loans?ICICI Bank provides interest rates on housing loans that are classified as ‘fixed’, ‘standard’, and ‘special’. The fixed option guarantees that the interest rate will stay constant throughout the loan duration.close disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI Bank
content: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI BankLoansHome LoanService ChargesFees And Service ChargesICICI Bank ensures that you get the best Loans in terms ofinterest ratesand other facilities. You can choose from Adjustable, Fixed or Floating Rate Loan.SMS HOME TO 5676766APPLY NOWChargesMortgage LoansLoan Processing Charges (Non Refundable)Upto 2% of loan amount.The processing/login fee is a one-timenon refundablefee and is collected by the Bank for the purpose of appraising the Application for the Facility and the same is independent of the outcome/result of such appraisal. The processing/login fee is payable at the time of submitting of the Application, by way of Cheque/Demand Draft favoring the Bank and/or such other mode as may be acceptable to the Bank.Administrative Charges0.25 % of Facility Amount or ₹ 5000/- whichever is lower.(The Administrative charges are a one-timenon-refundablecharges collected by the Lender for the purpose of appraising the valuation and legal verification of property to ascertain suitability of accepting the property for mortgage and the same is independent of the outcome /result of such appraisal. Please note that the administrative charges are payable at the time of disbursement of the Facility)Commitment charges / Non utilisation fee (Applicable for Overdraft Facility)Minimum 30% utilization required on a quarterly average basis. Charge of 0.5% will be levied on the deficit amount*.* Not applicable for salaried customersPart Prepayment FeesNilPrepayment Charges1. For the Facility with Fixed Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:2% on Home loan, Home improvement loan, Land loan and Top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.4% on Non-home loan (i.e. Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards Prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.Nil Prepayment charges on fixed rate loans if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Small or Micro & Loan amount is less than or equal to ₹ 50 lacs.2. For the Facility with Adjustable Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:Nil prepayment charges on home loan, home improvement loan and land loanNil prepayment charges on top up on home loan where the Borrower(s) is individual and the end use of the loan facility is other than business purpose.2% on top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to Non-Individual Borrower(s) for all-purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Non-home loan (Loan against property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance , Overdraft) where loan is given to Individual Borrower(s) and the end use of the Facility is other than business purpose.4% on Non-home loan (Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to non-individual Borrower(s) for all purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Money Saver Account.Conversion chargesFor all floating (adjustable) rate linked term loan to Fixed or floating (adjustable) ₹ 3,000.Semi Fixed / Fixed Interest Rate to Adjustable Interest Rate - 2% of the principal outstandingFor Overdraft - 0.5% of the principal outstandingCheque/ECS/NACH dishonor Charges, per transaction₹ 500/- charges per bounce/return/dishonor of cheques and /or any payment instruction including AD / ECS / NEFT / E-Cheque or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Cheque/Repayment mode swap charges₹ 500/-Penal Charges in the event of default/delay in payment/repayment of any part of the loan amount on due datePenal Charges shall be equal to 5% per annum on the overdue sum from the due date to the actual payment date plus applicable taxes or other statutory levies, if any.Charges for Amortisation Schedule₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for Statement of account₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for prepayment statement₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for duplicate NOC/No Dues Certificate₹ 250/-Charge for revalidation of no objection certificate₹ 250/-Penal charges for non-submission of the post disbursement documents₹ 5000/- per month (will be levied from the day the document is due till the same is not submitted)Penal charges for non-collection of property documents post 60 days from the loan closure date₹ 1,000/- Every month charges will be levied till collection of documents.Penal Charges for breach of construction timelineIn case of land loan, the Borrower(s) shall complete the construction of the house within 4 years. If the construction of the house is not completed within 4 years from the first disbursement date the Borrower shall be liable to pay Penal Charges as under -1% annually on the principal outstanding or ₹ 50,000/- whichever is lower or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Penal Charges will be levied every year after 4 years till the construction is completed.Renewal Fees (Applicable for Overdraft Product)₹ 5,000/-Not applicable for Money Saver and Insta OD.Loan / Property Document Retreival Charges₹ 500/-Cash Transaction Charges (for repayment of EMI due in cash at branches)₹ 100/-Information utility charges (Only for corporate cases)₹ 300/-Non-refundable charges under Central Registry of Securitization Asset Reconstruction and Security Interest of India (CERSAI)₹ 50/- (For loan upto 5L)₹ 100/- (For loan above 5L)Auction charges for repossessed assetAt ActualsCharges incurred in filing legal suitAt ActualsCharges incurred in SARFAESI proceedingsAt ActualsEnforcement chargesAt ActualsNon Maintenance of Mode of Payment charges (NMMP)₹ 800/-Paper advertisement chargesAt ActualsProfessional charges (Advocate Charges/Retainer ship Charges)At ActualsRepossession chargesAt ActualsSecurity guard chargesAt ActualsNoteGoods & Service Tax and other taxes, levies, etc. applicable as per prevailing rate will be charged over and above these chargesPlease Note:Time frame for Disposal of Loan Application Form (MSE Borrower) is as below:(from the date of receipt, provided your application is complete in all respects and is accompanied by documents as per 'check list' provided)Up to ₹ 25 lakhwithin 14 working daysAbove ₹ 25 lakhwithin 6 weeksAPPLY NOWclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Confirming Construction of the House | ICICI Bank
content: Confirming Construction of the House | ICICI BankLoansHome LoanLand LoanSubmission of documents confirming construction of the houseSubmission of documents confirming construction of the houseWe refer to the Loan(s) availed from ICICI Bank for the construction of a house on a plot/land (‘Facility’).As per the declaration provided to ICICI Bank, the construction of the house on the said plot/land was supposed to get completed within a period of 4 (four) years from the date of first disbursement of the sanctioned amount.Please visit any ICICI Bank Loan Servicing Branch and submit the below mentioned documents. Ensure that the property address mentioned in the below documents is the same property address on which the said plot/land was availed.Occupancy certificate issued by the competent authority ORCompletion certificate issued by the architect ORElectricity bill.Please submit the request within 30 (thirty) days from the receipt of this communication. In case the above documents are not received within the stipulated timeline, penal charges to the extent of 1% or Rs 50,000 whichever is lower, of the Facility outstanding plus applicable taxes, would be charged to the Loan Account annually till any of the above documents are submitted to the Bank.To locate your nearest ICICI Bank Loan Servicing Branchclick hereclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Land Loan EMI Calculator - Calculate Land Loan EMI Online
content: Land Loan EMI Calculator - Calculate Land Loan EMI OnlineLoansHome LoanLand LoanLand Loan EMI CalculatorLand Loan EMI CalculatorCalculator Land Loan EMIWhen planning to purchase land, understanding your financial commitments is crucial. One essential tool that can help you manage your finances effectively is the Land Loan EMI Calculator.APPLY FOR LAND LOANLand Loan EMI Calculator FAQsUnderstanding Land Loan EMIEquated Monthly instalment (EMI) is the fixed amount you pay every month towards the repayment of your loan. It includes both the principal amount and the interest. The EMI amount remains constant throughout the loan tenure, making it easier for borrowers to plan their finances.Why Use a Land Loan EMI Calculator?Land loan EMI calculator can be used for various reasons:Financial Planning:Knowing your EMI helps you plan your budget better and ensures you don’t overcommit financially.Loan Comparison:It allows you to compare different loan offers based on the EMIs, helping you choose the most suitable option.Quick and Accurate:The calculator provides instant and accurate results, saving you from complex manual calculations.Transparency:It gives you a clear picture of your repayment schedule, helping you understand the distribution of interest and principal over the loan tenure.How to Use the ICICI Bank Land Loan EMI CalculatorOurLand Loan EMI Calculatoris designed to be user-friendly and efficient.Here’s a step-by-step guide on how to use it:Enter Loan Amount:Input the total amount you intend to borrow for purchasing the land.Enter Interest Rate:Input the interest rate offered by the lender.Select Loan Tenure:Choose the tenure of the loan, typically in months or years.Calculate EMI:Click the 'Calculate' button to instantly view your EMI amount.Formula to Calculator Land Loan EMIEMI = [P x R x (1+R)^N] / [(1+R)^N - 1]​Here:P is the principal loan amount (Rs. 20,00,000)R is the monthly interest rateN is the loan tenure in monthsLoan amount (P) = Rs. 20,00,000Annual interest rate = 8%Monthly interest rate (c) = 8% / 12 = 0.00667Loan tenure (n) = 10 years × 12 months = 120 monthsEMI = [20,00,000 × 0.00667 × (1+0.00667)^120] / [(1+0.00667)^120-1] = ₹24,278Therefore, the monthly EMI for a loan of Rs. 20,00,000 at 8% annual interest rate for a tenure of 10 years is approximately Rs. 24,278.Benefits of Using ICICI Bank’s Land Loan EMI CalculatorEase of Use:The calculator is straightforward and user-friendly, making it accessible to everyone.Instant Results:Get quick and accurate EMI calculations to aid your financial planning.Multiple Scenarios:You can try different loan amounts, interest rates, and tenures to see how they affect your EMI, helping you find the best loan structure.Informed Decisions:With a clear understanding of your EMI, you can make informed decisions about your loan and repayment strategy.close disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Home Loan Interest Rates @7.70%* (2025) | ICICI Bank
content: Home Loan Interest Rates @7.70%* (2025) | ICICI BankLoansHome LoanInterest RateHome Loan Interest Rates - August 2025Buy your dream home with ICICI Bank's attractive Home Loan offers! Choose between floating and fixed interest rates as per your needs. Get a Home Loan up to ₹ 5 Crore* with minimal documentation and step into your new home sooner.Customers with an Instant Home Loan can get online sanction of their Home Loan at a rate of interest of 7.70%* p.a.*T&Cs apply. Rate of interest is subject to bureau score and applicable for Instant Home Loans through the digital platform / journey.APPLY NOWRepo Rate effective June 7th, 2025 – 5.50%Special Home Loan RatesGet customised Home Loan rates tailored to your credit score. Enjoy personalised lending options that fit your financial needs.Credit ScoreSalaried CustomersSelf-Employed Customers8008.75%8.75%750 – 8008.75%8.85%The above-mentioned interest rates are linked to the repo rate and will be valid till 31st August, 2025.Standard Home Loan Interest RateICICI Bank offers Home Loans with standard interest rates that cater to your financial needs. Our tiered loan slabs ensure that home financing is convenient and accessible, supporting a diverse range of borrowers.Loan SlabSalaried CustomersSelf-Employed CustomersUp to ₹ 35 lakh8.75% - 9.40%8.75% - 9.55%₹ 35 lakh to ₹ 75 lakh8.75% - 9.55%8.75% - 9.70%Above ₹ 75 lakh8.75% - 9.65%8.750% -9.80%The interest rates mentioned above for Home Loans vary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.All the interest rates mentioned above are linked to the repo rateThe processing fee is 0.5% of the loan amount + applicable taxesThe above-mentioned interest rates are valid till 31st August, 2025.Fixed Home Loan Interest RatesLooking for stability in your Home Loan payments? ICICI Bank’s fixed Home Loan interest rates offer just that. Lock in your interest rate for the entire loan tenure and enjoy predictable EMIs throughout..Fixed TenureRate of Interest24 Months Fixed8.85%37 Months Fixed8.65%-8.80%60 Months Fixed120 Months Fixed10.75%-11.80%Full Term Fixed10.90%-11.20%The interest rates mentioned above forHome Loansvary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.The interest rates for fixed home loans will be valid till 31st August, 2025.Interest Rates for Non-Housing Loans: Loan Against Property/Non-Residential Premises/Lease Rental DiscountingLoan SlabSalaried/ Self-Employed (PSL)Self-Employed (Non-PSL)Up to ₹ 50 lakh11.10%-11.75%11.60%-12.25%₹ 50 lakh to ₹ 100 lakh10.85%-11.50%11.35%-12.00%Above ₹ 100 lakh10.60%-11.25%11.10%-11.75%The interest rates mentioned above vary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.All the interest rates mentioned above are linked to the repo rateThe above-mentioned interest rates are valid till 31st August, 2025.FAQs on Home Loan Interest RatesWhat is a Home Loan interest rate?The interest rate on a Home Loan is the percentage charged as interest by the lender on the total amount an individual borrows to buy or refinance a residential property.What are the current Home Loan interest rates offered by ICICI Bank?The current Home Loan interest rates offered by ICICI Bank can be checked in the table given above.How can the interest rate of a Home Loan be reduced?The interest rate of home loan depends on multiple factors such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc. Customers can also compare interest rates offered by different banks and can transfer their existing loan to a favourable lender, if applicable.Which interest rate is known as the perfect option?Different types of interest rates are suitable for different customers. You can clickhereto see the various interest rates offered by ICICI Bank on Home Loans.How does the EMI for a Home Loan get calculated?The EMI of a Home Loan is calculated basis the loan amount, the applicable rate of interest and the loan duration (tenure). You can visitthispage to know more.What are the interest rates charged on the Home Loans?ICICI Bank provides competitive interest rates on Home Loans which are linked to the repo rate published by the RBI. You can check the current interest rates for Home Loans at the beginning of this page.Are there any other factors that determine the interest rates on Home Loans?Yes. Factors like credit score play a crucial role in deciding the interest rate that an individual pays on their Home Loan.How can I find out the EMI amount for a specific Home Loan?All applicants can easily find out the EMI amount by using our Home Loan EMI Calculator. To use the calculator, you must provide the interest rate, tenure and loan amount and you will be shown the interest payable and EMI amount instantly.What are the types of Home Loan interest rates?The choice of interest rate can greatly affect your home loan EMIs. Here are the two main types:1. Floating Interest Rate:This rate varies with market conditions, offering potential savings but also carries the risk of the rate being increased. This is suitable for customers who can handle uncertainty.2. Fixed Interest Rate:A fixed interest rates provides stability, ensuring consistent EMIs throughout the loan term, making budgeting easier.How are interest payments calculated?Interest payments are calculated using the below methods:1. Flat Interest Rate:Calculates interest on the full loan amount for the entire loan term, leading to higher total interest costs.2. Reducing Balance Method:Interest is calculated on the remaining principal balance. As you repay, the interest may increase or decrease, affecting the overall loan cost.What aspects can affect the rate of interest on home loans?Below are some important aspects that are considered when deciding the Home Loan interest rate:Credit Score:All lenders consider the loan applicant's credit score. People with a higher credit score are more likely to be eligible for a higher Home LoanLTV (Loan to Value) Ratio:This is the proportion of the loan amount that goes towards the home's appraised valueEconomic Conditions:Broader economic aspects such as central bank policies, market trends and inflation can impact interest ratesBorrower’s Debt-To-Income Ratio:All lenders check the borrower’s debt and income levels to determine their repayment capacity and accordingly, the interest rate.How can I save on my Home Loan interest payment?Make additional repayments:When you make extra repayments towards the principal amount, you reduce the outstanding loan amount and consequently, the interest to be paidChoose a shorter loan duration:Opting for a loan with a shorter duration (tenure) will result in higher monthly payments but lower interest payoutNegotiate with the lender:If applicable, you should negotiate with the lender to obtain a lower interest rate.How do I check the overall interest payout of the Home Loan?To calculate the overall interest payout for the Home Loan, use the online Home Loan Calculator offered by ICICI Bank.  Provide the tenure, interest rate and loan amount to check the interest you must pay during the loan term.What are the various kinds of interest rates for housing loans?ICICI Bank provides interest rates on housing loans that are classified as ‘fixed’, ‘standard’, and ‘special’. The fixed option guarantees that the interest rate will stay constant throughout the loan duration.close disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI Bank
content: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI BankLoansHome LoanService ChargesFees And Service ChargesICICI Bank ensures that you get the best Loans in terms ofinterest ratesand other facilities. You can choose from Adjustable, Fixed or Floating Rate Loan.SMS HOME TO 5676766APPLY NOWChargesMortgage LoansLoan Processing Charges (Non Refundable)Upto 2% of loan amount.The processing/login fee is a one-timenon refundablefee and is collected by the Bank for the purpose of appraising the Application for the Facility and the same is independent of the outcome/result of such appraisal. The processing/login fee is payable at the time of submitting of the Application, by way of Cheque/Demand Draft favoring the Bank and/or such other mode as may be acceptable to the Bank.Administrative Charges0.25 % of Facility Amount or ₹ 5000/- whichever is lower.(The Administrative charges are a one-timenon-refundablecharges collected by the Lender for the purpose of appraising the valuation and legal verification of property to ascertain suitability of accepting the property for mortgage and the same is independent of the outcome /result of such appraisal. Please note that the administrative charges are payable at the time of disbursement of the Facility)Commitment charges / Non utilisation fee (Applicable for Overdraft Facility)Minimum 30% utilization required on a quarterly average basis. Charge of 0.5% will be levied on the deficit amount*.* Not applicable for salaried customersPart Prepayment FeesNilPrepayment Charges1. For the Facility with Fixed Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:2% on Home loan, Home improvement loan, Land loan and Top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.4% on Non-home loan (i.e. Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards Prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.Nil Prepayment charges on fixed rate loans if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Small or Micro & Loan amount is less than or equal to ₹ 50 lacs.2. For the Facility with Adjustable Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:Nil prepayment charges on home loan, home improvement loan and land loanNil prepayment charges on top up on home loan where the Borrower(s) is individual and the end use of the loan facility is other than business purpose.2% on top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to Non-Individual Borrower(s) for all-purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Non-home loan (Loan against property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance , Overdraft) where loan is given to Individual Borrower(s) and the end use of the Facility is other than business purpose.4% on Non-home loan (Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to non-individual Borrower(s) for all purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Money Saver Account.Conversion chargesFor all floating (adjustable) rate linked term loan to Fixed or floating (adjustable) ₹ 3,000.Semi Fixed / Fixed Interest Rate to Adjustable Interest Rate - 2% of the principal outstandingFor Overdraft - 0.5% of the principal outstandingCheque/ECS/NACH dishonor Charges, per transaction₹ 500/- charges per bounce/return/dishonor of cheques and /or any payment instruction including AD / ECS / NEFT / E-Cheque or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Cheque/Repayment mode swap charges₹ 500/-Penal Charges in the event of default/delay in payment/repayment of any part of the loan amount on due datePenal Charges shall be equal to 5% per annum on the overdue sum from the due date to the actual payment date plus applicable taxes or other statutory levies, if any.Charges for Amortisation Schedule₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for Statement of account₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for prepayment statement₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for duplicate NOC/No Dues Certificate₹ 250/-Charge for revalidation of no objection certificate₹ 250/-Penal charges for non-submission of the post disbursement documents₹ 5000/- per month (will be levied from the day the document is due till the same is not submitted)Penal charges for non-collection of property documents post 60 days from the loan closure date₹ 1,000/- Every month charges will be levied till collection of documents.Penal Charges for breach of construction timelineIn case of land loan, the Borrower(s) shall complete the construction of the house within 4 years. If the construction of the house is not completed within 4 years from the first disbursement date the Borrower shall be liable to pay Penal Charges as under -1% annually on the principal outstanding or ₹ 50,000/- whichever is lower or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Penal Charges will be levied every year after 4 years till the construction is completed.Renewal Fees (Applicable for Overdraft Product)₹ 5,000/-Not applicable for Money Saver and Insta OD.Loan / Property Document Retreival Charges₹ 500/-Cash Transaction Charges (for repayment of EMI due in cash at branches)₹ 100/-Information utility charges (Only for corporate cases)₹ 300/-Non-refundable charges under Central Registry of Securitization Asset Reconstruction and Security Interest of India (CERSAI)₹ 50/- (For loan upto 5L)₹ 100/- (For loan above 5L)Auction charges for repossessed assetAt ActualsCharges incurred in filing legal suitAt ActualsCharges incurred in SARFAESI proceedingsAt ActualsEnforcement chargesAt ActualsNon Maintenance of Mode of Payment charges (NMMP)₹ 800/-Paper advertisement chargesAt ActualsProfessional charges (Advocate Charges/Retainer ship Charges)At ActualsRepossession chargesAt ActualsSecurity guard chargesAt ActualsNoteGoods & Service Tax and other taxes, levies, etc. applicable as per prevailing rate will be charged over and above these chargesPlease Note:Time frame for Disposal of Loan Application Form (MSE Borrower) is as below:(from the date of receipt, provided your application is complete in all respects and is accompanied by documents as per 'check list' provided)Up to ₹ 25 lakhwithin 14 working daysAbove ₹ 25 lakhwithin 6 weeksAPPLY NOWclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED
