Choose between floating and fixed interest rates as per your needs. Get a Home Loan up to ₹ 5 Crore* with minimal documentation and step into your new home sooner.Customers with an Instant Home Loan can get online sanction of their Home Loan at a rate of interest of 7.70%* p.a.*T&Cs apply. Rate of interest is subject to bureau score and applicable for Instant Home Loans through the digital platform / journey.APPLY NOWRepo Rate effective June 7th, 2025 – 5.50%Special Home Loan RatesGet customised Home Loan rates tailored to your credit score. Enjoy personalised lending options that fit your financial needs.Credit ScoreSalaried CustomersSelf-Employed Customers8008.75%8.75%750 – 8008.75%8.85%The above-mentioned interest rates are linked to the repo rate and will be valid till 31st August, 2025.Standard Home Loan Interest RateICICI Bank offers Home Loans with standard interest rates that cater to your financial needs. Our tiered loan slabs ensure that home financing is convenient and accessible, supporting a diverse range of borrowers.Loan SlabSalaried CustomersSelf-Employed CustomersUp to ₹ 35 lakh8.75% - 9.40%8.75% - 9.55%₹ 35 lakh to ₹ 75 lakh8.75% - 9.55%8.75% - 9.70%Above ₹ 75 lakh8.75% - 9.65%8.750% -9.80%The interest rates mentioned above for Home Loans vary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.All the interest rates mentioned above are linked to the repo rateThe processing fee is 0.5% of the loan amount + applicable taxesThe above-mentioned interest rates are valid till 31st August, 2025.Fixed Home Loan Interest RatesLooking for stability in your Home Loan payments? ICICI Bank’s fixed Home Loan interest rates offer just that. Lock in your interest rate for the entire loan tenure and enjoy predictable EMIs throughout..Fixed TenureRate of Interest24 Months Fixed8.85%37 Months Fixed8.65%-8.80%60 Months Fixed120 Months Fixed10.75%-11.80%Full Term Fixed10.90%-11.20%The interest rates mentioned above forHome Loansvary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.The interest rates for fixed home loans will be valid till 31st August, 2025.Interest Rates for Non-Housing Loans: Loan Against Property/Non-Residential Premises/Lease Rental DiscountingLoan SlabSalaried/ Self-Employed (PSL)Self-Employed (Non-PSL)Up to ₹ 50 lakh11.10%-11.75%11.60%-12.25%₹ 50 lakh to ₹ 100 lakh10.85%-11.50%11.35%-12.00%Above ₹ 100 lakh10.60%-11.25%11.10%-11.75%The interest rates mentioned above vary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.All the interest rates mentioned above are linked to the repo rateThe above-mentioned interest rates are valid till 31st August, 2025.FAQs on Home Loan Interest RatesWhat is a Home Loan interest rate?The interest rate on a Home Loan is the percentage charged as interest by the lender on the total amount an individual borrows to buy or refinance a residential property.What are the current Home Loan interest rates offered by ICICI Bank?The current Home Loan interest rates offered by ICICI Bank can be checked in the table given above.How can the interest rate of a Home Loan be reduced?The interest rate of home loan depends on multiple factors such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc. Customers can also compare interest rates offered by different banks and can transfer their existing loan to a favourable lender, if applicable.Which interest rate is known as the perfect option?Different types of interest rates are suitable for different customers. You can clickhereto see the various interest rates offered by ICICI Bank on Home Loans.How does the EMI for a Home Loan get calculated?The EMI of a Home Loan is calculated basis the loan amount, the applicable rate of interest and the loan duration (tenure). You can visitthispage to know more.What are the interest rates charged on the Home Loans?ICICI Bank provides competitive interest rates on Home Loans which are linked to the repo rate published by the RBI. You can check the current interest rates for Home Loans at the beginning of this page.Are there any other factors that determine the interest rates on Home Loans?Yes. Factors like credit score play a crucial role in deciding the interest rate that an individual pays on their Home Loan.How can I find out the EMI amount for a specific Home Loan?All applicants can easily find out the EMI amount by using our Home Loan EMI Calculator. To use the calculator, you must provide the interest rate, tenure and loan amount and you will be shown the interest payable and EMI amount instantly.What are the types of Home Loan interest rates?The choice of interest rate can greatly affect your home loan EMIs. Here are the two main types:1. Floating Interest Rate:This rate varies with market conditions, offering potential savings but also carries the risk of the rate being increased. This is suitable for customers who can handle uncertainty.2. Fixed Interest Rate:A fixed interest rates provides stability, ensuring consistent EMIs throughout the loan term, making budgeting easier.How are interest payments calculated?Interest payments are calculated using the below methods:1. Flat Interest Rate:Calculates interest on the full loan amount for the entire loan term, leading to higher total interest costs.2. Reducing Balance Method:Interest is calculated on the remaining principal balance. As you repay, the interest may increase or decrease, affecting the overall loan cost.What aspects can affect the rate of interest on home loans?Below are some important aspects that are considered when deciding the Home Loan interest rate:Credit Score:All lenders consider the loan applicant's credit score. People with a higher credit score are more likely to be eligible for a higher Home LoanLTV (Loan to Value) Ratio:This is the proportion of the loan amount that goes towards the home's appraised valueEconomic Conditions:Broader economic aspects such as central bank policies, market trends and inflation can impact interest ratesBorrower’s Debt-To-Income Ratio:All lenders check the borrower’s debt and income levels to determine their repayment capacity and accordingly, the interest rate.How can I save on my Home Loan interest payment?Make additional repayments:When you make extra repayments towards the principal amount, you reduce the outstanding loan amount and consequently, the interest to be paidChoose a shorter loan duration:Opting for a loan with a shorter duration (tenure) will result in higher monthly payments but lower interest payoutNegotiate with the lender:If applicable, you should negotiate with the lender to obtain a lower interest rate.How do I check the overall interest payout of the Home Loan?To calculate the overall interest payout for the Home Loan, use the online Home Loan Calculator offered by ICICI Bank.  Provide the tenure, interest rate and loan amount to check the interest you must pay during the loan term.What are the various kinds of interest rates for housing loans?ICICI Bank provides interest rates on housing loans that are classified as ‘fixed’, ‘standard’, and ‘special’. The fixed option guarantees that the interest rate will stay constant throughout the loan duration.close disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI Bank
content: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI BankLoansHome LoanService ChargesFees And Service ChargesICICI Bank ensures that you get the best Loans in terms ofinterest ratesand other facilities. You can choose from Adjustable, Fixed or Floating Rate Loan.SMS HOME TO 5676766APPLY NOWChargesMortgage LoansLoan Processing Charges (Non Refundable)Upto 2% of loan amount.The processing/login fee is a one-timenon refundablefee and is collected by the Bank for the purpose of appraising the Application for the Facility and the same is independent of the outcome/result of such appraisal. The processing/login fee is payable at the time of submitting of the Application, by way of Cheque/Demand Draft favoring the Bank and/or such other mode as may be acceptable to the Bank.Administrative Charges0.25 % of Facility Amount or ₹ 5000/- whichever is lower.(The Administrative charges are a one-timenon-refundablecharges collected by the Lender for the purpose of appraising the valuation and legal verification of property to ascertain suitability of accepting the property for mortgage and the same is independent of the outcome /result of such appraisal. Please note that the administrative charges are payable at the time of disbursement of the Facility)Commitment charges / Non utilisation fee (Applicable for Overdraft Facility)Minimum 30% utilization required on a quarterly average basis. Charge of 0.5% will be levied on the deficit amount*.* Not applicable for salaried customersPart Prepayment FeesNilPrepayment Charges1. For the Facility with Fixed Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:2% on Home loan, Home improvement loan, Land loan and Top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.4% on Non-home loan (i.e. Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards Prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.Nil Prepayment charges on fixed rate loans if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Small or Micro & Loan amount is less than or equal to ₹ 50 lacs.2. For the Facility with Adjustable Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:Nil prepayment charges on home loan, home improvement loan and land loanNil prepayment charges on top up on home loan where the Borrower(s) is individual and the end use of the loan facility is other than business purpose.2% on top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to Non-Individual Borrower(s) for all-purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Non-home loan (Loan against property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance , Overdraft) where loan is given to Individual Borrower(s) and the end use of the Facility is other than business purpose.4% on Non-home loan (Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to non-individual Borrower(s) for all purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Money Saver Account.Conversion chargesFor all floating (adjustable) rate linked term loan to Fixed or floating (adjustable) ₹ 3,000.Semi Fixed / Fixed Interest Rate to Adjustable Interest Rate - 2% of the principal outstandingFor Overdraft - 0.5% of the principal outstandingCheque/ECS/NACH dishonor Charges, per transaction₹ 500/- charges per bounce/return/dishonor of cheques and /or any payment instruction including AD / ECS / NEFT / E-Cheque or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Cheque/Repayment mode swap charges₹ 500/-Penal Charges in the event of default/delay in payment/repayment of any part of the loan amount on due datePenal Charges shall be equal to 5% per annum on the overdue sum from the due date to the actual payment date plus applicable taxes or other statutory levies, if any.Charges for Amortisation Schedule₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for Statement of account₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for prepayment statement₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for duplicate NOC/No Dues Certificate₹ 250/-Charge for revalidation of no objection certificate₹ 250/-Penal charges for non-submission of the post disbursement documents₹ 5000/- per month (will be levied from the day the document is due till the same is not submitted)Penal charges for non-collection of property documents post 60 days from the loan closure date₹ 1,000/- Every month charges will be levied till collection of documents.Penal Charges for breach of construction timelineIn case of land loan, the Borrower(s) shall complete the construction of the house within 4 years. If the construction of the house is not completed within 4 years from the first disbursement date the Borrower shall be liable to pay Penal Charges as under -1% annually on the principal outstanding or ₹ 50,000/- whichever is lower or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Penal Charges will be levied every year after 4 years till the construction is completed.Renewal Fees (Applicable for Overdraft Product)₹ 5,000/-Not applicable for Money Saver and Insta OD.Loan / Property Document Retreival Charges₹ 500/-Cash Transaction Charges (for repayment of EMI due in cash at branches)₹ 100/-Information utility charges (Only for corporate cases)₹ 300/-Non-refundable charges under Central Registry of Securitization Asset Reconstruction and Security Interest of India (CERSAI)₹ 50/- (For loan upto 5L)₹ 100/- (For loan above 5L)Auction charges for repossessed assetAt ActualsCharges incurred in filing legal suitAt ActualsCharges incurred in SARFAESI proceedingsAt ActualsEnforcement chargesAt ActualsNon Maintenance of Mode of Payment charges (NMMP)₹ 800/-Paper advertisement chargesAt ActualsProfessional charges (Advocate Charges/Retainer ship Charges)At ActualsRepossession chargesAt ActualsSecurity guard chargesAt ActualsNoteGoods & Service Tax and other taxes, levies, etc. applicable as per prevailing rate will be charged over and above these chargesPlease Note:Time frame for Disposal of Loan Application Form (MSE Borrower) is as below:(from the date of receipt, provided your application is complete in all respects and is accompanied by documents as per 'check list' provided)Up to ₹ 25 lakhwithin 14 working daysAbove ₹ 25 lakhwithin 6 weeksAPPLY NOWclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Home Loan Balance Transfer Document Required
content: Home Loan Balance Transfer Document RequiredLoansHome LoanBalance TransferRequired DocumentsICICI Bank Balance Transfer Documents RequiredFollowing are all the documents required while availing the Balance Transfer loan:CHECK YOUR ELIGIBILITYHome Loan Documents by Employment Type:Below is the list of documents required for a Mortgage Loan based on profile:Individuals:Identity Proof & Address Proof of Individuals: Aadhaar/Passport/Driving License/Voter ID/National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (NREGA) Card/Letter from the National Population Register (NPR) containing details of your name and address.DOB Proof: Passport/Driving License/Voter ID/NREGA Card/Letter from the NPR containing details of your name and address.Non-Individuals (Entity):Identity Proof: Registration Certificate including Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) issued by the Government/Certificate/License issued by the municipal authorities under Shop and Establishment Act/Sales and Income Tax returns/CST/VAT/GST Certificate/Certificate/Registration document issued by Sales Tax/Service Tax/Professional Tax authorities/ IEC (Importer Exporter Code) issued to the proprietary concern by the office of the Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT)/License/Certificate of practice issued in the name of the proprietary concern by any professional body incorporated under a statute/Complete Income Tax Returns (not just the acknowledgement) in the name of the Sole Proprietor where the firm's income is reflecting, duly authenticated/acknowledged by the Income Tax authorities/Utility bills such as electricity, water, landline telephone bills etc.Note :-For sole proprietorship concerns, any of the above-mentioned two documents are required.Address Proof: GST Certificate/Business Registration Certificate/Gumastaa License/Udhyam Registration Certificate/Bank statement (not to be considered for entity proof)/Utility Bill/ITR/Rent Agreement with utility bill within 2 months.Note :-If the registered address and permanent address of the entity are different – proof is required in both cases.Apart from the above-mentioned document, additional documents will be required for the below entities:Partnership Firm: Partnership DeedLimited Liability Partnership: LLP Agreement and Certificate of Incorporation, List of designated partners and latest profit-sharing ratio certified by a Chartered Accountant (CA)/Company Secretary (CS)Public & Private Limited Co. (Even if there is only 1 director): Certificate of Incorporation, Memorandum of Association (MOA) and Articles of Association (AOA), CA/CS certified latest list of Directors and Shareholders with their names, date of birth, nationality and addressTrust: Trust Deed with Registration Certificate, list of all beneficiaries, trustees, settlors, protectors and authors of the trust, containing their names and Date of BirthSociety: By-laws/Memorandum of a Society with Registration Certificate, list of members with their names, address and Date of BirthHUF: List of Adult Coparceners (Joint Heirs) attested by the Karta (Head of the family)Authorised signatory along with KYC and Relationship Segment details in case of Private/Public Limited Companies/Limited Liability Partnerships/Partnership Firms/Trust/SocietyList of Directors and Senior Management details in case of Private/Public Limited CompaniesLegal Entity Identifier (LEI) Certificate of non-individual borrowers having a banking system exposure of ₹ 5 crore and above.Beneficial owner details along with KYC documents as per below:In case of Company/Partnership Firms/Limited Liability Partnership, more than 10% of shares/capital/profit of the companyIn case of Unincorporated Association or Body of Person/Individual, more than 15% of capital/profit of the companyIn case of author of the trust, the trustee, the beneficiaries with 10% and more interest in the trust.Below is the list of documents required for a Mortgage Loan based on employment:Income Proof:Salaried:Latest Form 16Latest one-month salary slipBank statements of the last 6 months.Self-Employed:Last 6 months’ Bank statements of all operative accountsLast 2 years CA Certified/Audited Income Tax Returns (ITR), computation of income, Profit and Loss Account Statement and Balance sheetGST returns of the last 1 year.Disclaimer:-This is an indicative list only. Additional documents may be required for a case-to-case basis.APPLY NOWclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Mortgage Loan Calculator: Loan Against Property Calculator Online
content: Mortgage Loan Calculator: Loan Against Property Calculator OnlineLoansHome LoanLoan Against PropertyMortgage Loan CalculatorSimplify Your Financial PlanningICICI Bank’s Loan Against Property EMI Calculator helps you calculate monthly instalments for your property loan with ease.About Loan Against Property EMI CalculatorWhat is a Loan Against Property EMI Calculator?It’s a tool provided by ICICI Bank to calculate your monthly instalments based on your loan amount, interest rate and tenure. It simplifies your financial planning and makes sure you choose a loan amount and tenure that suit your budget.How do you use ICICI Bank’s Loan Against Property EMI Calculator?Enter the loan amount, interest rate and tenure in the calculator. It instantly shows your estimated EMI and the breakdown of total payable amount into principal and payable interest.How can the Loan Against Property EMI Calculator help in financial planning?The calculator provides an estimate of your monthly EMI and total repayment amount. This helps you plan your finances better by making sure that the loan fits within your budget, avoiding any strain on your monthly budget.FAQsCan I use the Loan Against Property EMI Calculator to adjust my loan tenure?Yes, the calculator provides you with options to experiment with tenures. You can adjust the tenure to see the impact on EMI. The higher the tenure, the lower the EMIs but greater will be the total interest, whereas shorter tenures will result in lesser interest but increased EMI.Does the calculator consider floating interest rates?Yes, the calculator considers the floating rate of interest rate for calculation. If you have a floating rate loan, then the actual EMI may vary depending on the interest rate changes over the tenure.Can the EMI Calculator help me decide on pre-payment?Yes, you can see how it impacts your EMI and total repayment if you enter a reduced principal amount after a pre-payment. This helps you decide whether pre-paying is a good financial decision.Is the Loan Against Property EMI Calculator accurate?The calculator provides highly accurate estimates based on the values you enter. However, the actual loan offer may vary slightly depending on factors like processing fees and your credit profile.Can I save the results from the calculator for future reference?No, the calculator does not save your results. You can note down the EMI, total interest and principal details for future reference. Alternatively, you can recalculate anytime by entering the same inputs in the calculator.Terms and conditions apply. Interest rates and charges are subject to periodic revisions. Please verify the latest details before applying.BlogsBlogsgoto previous cardgoto next cardgoto previous cardgoto next cardCloseclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

(LAP)Get funds with your property as a collateral.About Home Loan Balance TransferWhat is a Home Loan Balance Transfer?A Home Loan Balance Transfer involves transferring your current Home Loan from your existing lender to a new one that offers more favourable terms. This can include better repayment options and the possibility of reducing your financial burden by switching to a more competitive lender.Benefits of Transferring your Home LoanTransferring your Home Loan offers multiple advantages. These include reduced EMIs, the potential for an additional Top-Up Loan and an extended repayment tenure. By shifting to a better lender, you can significantly save on interest, while improving your loan terms and repayment flexibility.FAQsBalance Transfer a good option for my Home Loan?Yes, transferring your Home Loan to a lender can give you an extended tenure and reduced EMIs. Use a Balance Transfer Calculator to compare savings before deciding.What are the eligibility criteria for a Home Loan Balance Transfer?To be eligible for a Home Loan Balance Transfer, you must have a good repayment track record with your existing lender. Additionally, a CIBIL score of 700+ (salaried &  self-employed) is required. Other factors like employment stability and property details may also be considered.Can I avail of a Top-Up Loan while transferring my Home Loan?Yes, ICICI Bank offers a Top-Up facility along with the Home Loan Balance Transfer. This allows you to get additional funds for personal or home-related expenses, without applying for a separate loan.How long does the Home Loan Balance Transfer process take?The transfer process typically takes a few days, depending on document verification and approval. With ICICI Bank’s online application and quick provisional sanction, you can get approval instantly, speeding up the overall process.BlogsBlogsgoto previous cardgoto next cardgoto previous cardgoto next cardCloseclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI Bank
content: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI BankLoansHome LoanService ChargesFees And Service ChargesICICI Bank ensures that you get the best Loans in terms ofinterest ratesand other facilities. You can choose from Adjustable, Fixed or Floating Rate Loan.SMS HOME TO 5676766APPLY NOWChargesMortgage LoansLoan Processing Charges (Non Refundable)Upto 2% of loan amount.The processing/login fee is a one-timenon refundablefee and is collected by the Bank for the purpose of appraising the Application for the Facility and the same is independent of the outcome/result of such appraisal. The processing/login fee is payable at the time of submitting of the Application, by way of Cheque/Demand Draft favoring the Bank and/or such other mode as may be acceptable to the Bank.Administrative Charges0.25 % of Facility Amount or ₹ 5000/- whichever is lower.(The Administrative charges are a one-timenon-refundablecharges collected by the Lender for the purpose of appraising the valuation and legal verification of property to ascertain suitability of accepting the property for mortgage and the same is independent of the outcome /result of such appraisal. Please note that the administrative charges are payable at the time of disbursement of the Facility)Commitment charges / Non utilisation fee (Applicable for Overdraft Facility)Minimum 30% utilization required on a quarterly average basis. Charge of 0.5% will be levied on the deficit amount*.* Not applicable for salaried customersPart Prepayment FeesNilPrepayment Charges1. For the Facility with Fixed Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:2% on Home loan, Home improvement loan, Land loan and Top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.4% on Non-home loan (i.e. Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards Prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.Nil Prepayment charges on fixed rate loans if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Small or Micro & Loan amount is less than or equal to ₹ 50 lacs.2. For the Facility with Adjustable Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:Nil prepayment charges on home loan, home improvement loan and land loanNil prepayment charges on top up on home loan where the Borrower(s) is individual and the end use of the loan facility is other than business purpose.2% on top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to Non-Individual Borrower(s) for all-purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Non-home loan (Loan against property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance , Overdraft) where loan is given to Individual Borrower(s) and the end use of the Facility is other than business purpose.4% on Non-home loan (Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to non-individual Borrower(s) for all purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Money Saver Account.Conversion chargesFor all floating (adjustable) rate linked term loan to Fixed or floating (adjustable) ₹ 3,000.Semi Fixed / Fixed Interest Rate to Adjustable Interest Rate - 2% of the principal outstandingFor Overdraft - 0.5% of the principal outstandingCheque/ECS/NACH dishonor Charges, per transaction₹ 500/- charges per bounce/return/dishonor of cheques and /or any payment instruction including AD / ECS / NEFT / E-Cheque or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Cheque/Repayment mode swap charges₹ 500/-Penal Charges in the event of default/delay in payment/repayment of any part of the loan amount on due datePenal Charges shall be equal to 5% per annum on the overdue sum from the due date to the actual payment date plus applicable taxes or other statutory levies, if any.Charges for Amortisation Schedule₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for Statement of account₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for prepayment statement₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for duplicate NOC/No Dues Certificate₹ 250/-Charge for revalidation of no objection certificate₹ 250/-Penal charges for non-submission of the post disbursement documents₹ 5000/- per month (will be levied from the day the document is due till the same is not submitted)Penal charges for non-collection of property documents post 60 days from the loan closure date₹ 1,000/- Every month charges will be levied till collection of documents.Penal Charges for breach of construction timelineIn case of land loan, the Borrower(s) shall complete the construction of the house within 4 years. If the construction of the house is not completed within 4 years from the first disbursement date the Borrower shall be liable to pay Penal Charges as under -1% annually on the principal outstanding or ₹ 50,000/- whichever is lower or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Penal Charges will be levied every year after 4 years till the construction is completed.Renewal Fees (Applicable for Overdraft Product)₹ 5,000/-Not applicable for Money Saver and Insta OD.Loan / Property Document Retreival Charges₹ 500/-Cash Transaction Charges (for repayment of EMI due in cash at branches)₹ 100/-Information utility charges (Only for corporate cases)₹ 300/-Non-refundable charges under Central Registry of Securitization Asset Reconstruction and Security Interest of India (CERSAI)₹ 50/- (For loan upto 5L)₹ 100/- (For loan above 5L)Auction charges for repossessed assetAt ActualsCharges incurred in filing legal suitAt ActualsCharges incurred in SARFAESI proceedingsAt ActualsEnforcement chargesAt ActualsNon Maintenance of Mode of Payment charges (NMMP)₹ 800/-Paper advertisement chargesAt ActualsProfessional charges (Advocate Charges/Retainer ship Charges)At ActualsRepossession chargesAt ActualsSecurity guard chargesAt ActualsNoteGoods & Service Tax and other taxes, levies, etc. applicable as per prevailing rate will be charged over and above these chargesPlease Note:Time frame for Disposal of Loan Application Form (MSE Borrower) is as below:(from the date of receipt, provided your application is complete in all respects and is accompanied by documents as per 'check list' provided)Up to ₹ 25 lakhwithin 14 working daysAbove ₹ 25 lakhwithin 6 weeksAPPLY NOWclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

Additional documents may be required for a case-to-case basis.VIEW DETAILED DOCUMENTATIONHow to Apply for Home Loan in few stepsEnter your detailsCheck your eligibilityPay the processing feeUpload DocumentsGet Provisional SanctionAPPLY NOWLooking for something else?Instant Home LoanInstant sanction with special processing fees.Instant Balance TransferInstant sanction with minimal documentation.About Home loansUnderstanding a Home LoanA Home Loan is a financial product that helps individuals purchase, build or renovate their homes. It provides funds based on the property value and the applicant’s eligibility. The Loan is typically repaid in easy monthly instalments (EMIs) over a long tenure.Benefits of a Home LoanHome Loans offer significant advantages, such as attractive interest rates, tax benefits under Section 80C and the ability to own a property without full upfront payment. They provide flexible repayment options, making it easier to manage finances. With a Home Loan, buying a home becomes more affordable and feasible.Are Home Loans a good option to buy property?Home Loans make it easier to invest in real estate, allowing individuals to purchase their dream home without having to save for and pay the entire price upfront. With attractive interest rates and long repayment periods, Home Loans ensure that buying a home is more accessible, affordable and financially manageable.Home Loan FAQsWhat is a home loan?A Home Loan provides funds for purchasing, constructing or renovating a property, which is repaid in monthly instalments over time (known as EMIs).How do I apply for a home loan?You can apply via the iMobile app, Internet Banking, the ICICI Bank website or by visiting any ICICI Bank Branch..What factors affect Home Loan eligibility?Eligibility is based on age (20–65 years for salaried individuals, 21–70 years for self-employed individuals), income, employment stability and credit score (ideally 750+) of the applicant.Take a word from our CustomersPPeddintli Rao Dodda4.5I want to express my sincere appreciation for the Relationship Manager who assisted me with my Home Loan application. His follow-up and guidance was instrumental in making the loan process fast and efficient. It took less than two days for the sanction. The disbursement was quick, covering the legal and technical aspects which is not possible with other banks. Thank you for such dedicated support and exceptional service.AAbhishek Gupta5I availed Home Loan from ICICI Bank and I will highly recommend it. The application process was simple, documentation requirements were clear and the Bank's team was responsive and professional. The loan approval and disbursal were on time and the transparency of the terms and conditions was commendable. Overall, I had a hassle-free and satisfying experience with ICICI Bank Home Loan team. I am grateful for the support and assistance I have received from the dedicated team of ICICI Bank. I am looking forward to a long and trusted relationship with ICICI Bank.SSuraj Srivastava4.5ICICI Bank and its Relationship Manager made my Home Loan process as simple as it could be. It just took 3 weeks right from the first enquiry call to the loan disbursement. Hats off to the team for their prompt actions, timely reminders for documents, closure of tasks etc. I will share my wonderful experience with others and strongly recommend ICICI Bank Home Loan to everyone. Thanks team.close disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

Loan, allowing you to borrow extra funds for personal purposes like home renovation, interiors, etc. It's a convenient and flexible financing option that helps meet various housing financial needs without new collateral.Benefits of a Top-up LoanTop-Up Loans offer several advantages, including easy access to funds, competitive interest rates and minimal documentation for existing customers. They provide a hassle-free way to borrow additional money while leveraging your existing Home Loan, ensuring a cost-effective and convenient borrowing experience.Application process for a Top-up LoanApplying for a Top-Up Loan is simple and fast. You can apply online by providing basic details, reviewing available Loan offers, confirming the information and uploading the required documents. This process helps you receive provisional approval quickly, giving you an easy pathway to access the funds you need.Tenure for a Top-up LoanThe tenure for a Top-Up Loan depends on factors like the duration of your existing Home Loan and your eligibility. A longer tenure allows for manageable monthly payments, offering you flexibility and convenience when repaying the Loan over time.How to Get Maximum Benefits?Use Funds for Multiple PurposesApply for a Top-Up Home Loan to meet needs like home renovation, redoing interiors, etc.Leverage Overdraft FacilityCombine your Top-Up Loan with an overdraft facility for added financial flexibility and quick access to funds.Long Repayment TenureGet the benefit of a flexible and long tenure. This way, you can choose a tenure that suits your budget.No Need for Additional CollateralThe loan is offered against your existing Home Loan, so no new collateral is required. title: 24-Hour Home Loan Top-Up | Disbursement in 24 Hrs at ICICI Bank
content: 24-Hour Home Loan Top-Up | Disbursement in 24 Hrs at ICICI BankLoansHome LoanTop-up Loan24 Hours Top Up LoanBenefits of the 24-Hour Top-Up LoanNeed urgent funds for home renovation or personal needs? Get a 24-Hour Top-Up Loan on your existing ICICI Bank Mortgage Loan with instant sanction, minimal paperwork and quick disbursal directly to your account.Apply NowHow to get maximum benefits?Instant Sanction with Minimal documentationQuick disbursal within 24 hours*Funds can be used for various needs such as home renovationNo fresh property documents neededAttractive interest ratesThings you should knowEligibilityOnly for existing ICICI Bank Mortgage Loan customers with a good repayment recordUsageFunds must be used for permitted personal needs like education, home renovation, medical emergencies, etc.DisbursalLoan amount is credited within 24 hours*, subject to successful verificationDocumentationMinimal documentation; No KYC documents requiredChargesProcessing fees and taxes as applicablePrepaymentPrepayment or foreclosure is subject to applicable fees and charges. Visit  Service Charges toknow moreVIEW DETAILED DOCUMENTATIONHow to Get a 24-Hour Top-Up LoanLog in as an existing customer on Express Home LoansCheck your loan detailsSubmit your application and download sanction letterAPPLY NOWFAQsWho can apply for the 24-Hour Top-Up Loan?Only existing ICICI Bank Mortgage Loan customers with good repayment records are eligible.How will I receive the loan amount?The amount will be directly credited to your loan repayment account via NEFT/RTGS/Fund Transfer.Is there a limit to how much I can borrow?Yes, the loan amount depends on your current outstanding loan, repayment history, and bank eligibility criteria.What can the Top-Up Loan be used for?The loan can be used for home renovation, medical expenses, education, wedding, travel, or any other personal requirement.Is income proof required for this Top-Up?In most cases, no fresh income documents are needed if you have a good repayment track record.close disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

You can select or reduce the loan tenure using the provided slider during application, subject to the maximum tenure set by ICICI Bank.Can I adjust the loan amount after applying?You can reduce the loan amount using the slider before finalising.Once the final sanction amount is declared by ICICI Bank, enhancement is not possible.What is the validity period of the Sanction Letter?The Sanction Letter remains valid for up to 6 months from the date of issue.BlogsBlogsgoto previous cardgoto next cardgoto previous cardgoto next cardCloseTake a word from our CustomersPPeddintli Rao Dodda4.5I want to express my sincere appreciation for the Relationship Manager who assisted me with my Home Loan application. The loan approval and disbursal were on time and the transparency of the terms and conditions was commendable. Overall, I had a hassle-free and satisfying experience with ICICI Bank Home Loan team. I am grateful for the support and assistance I have received from the dedicated team of ICICI Bank. I am looking forward to a long and trusted relationship with ICICI Bank.SSuraj Srivastava4.5ICICI Bank and its Relationship Manager made my Home Loan process as simple as it could be. It just took 3 weeks right from the first enquiry call to the loan disbursement. Hats off to the team for their prompt actions, timely reminders for documents, closure of tasks etc. I will share my wonderful experience with others and strongly recommend ICICI Bank Home Loan to everyone. Thanks team.close disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

KingdomUnited StatesUruguayUzbekistanVanuatuVaticanVenezuelaVietnamWallis And FutunaWestern SaharaYemenZambiaZimbabweConfirmSUBMITClose ModalSUITABLE FORTop-up Loan to renovate and upgrade your homeUse funds to upgrade your homeMake your dream home a reality!VIEW INTEREST RATESAbout Home Loan Top-UpUnderstanding a Top-up LoanA Top-up Loan is an additional loan added to your existing Home Loan, allowing you to borrow extra funds for personal purposes like home renovation, interiors, etc. It's a convenient and flexible financing option that helps meet various housing financial needs without new collateral.Benefits of a Top-up LoanTop-Up Loans offer several advantages, including easy access to funds, competitive interest rates and minimal documentation for existing customers. They provide a hassle-free way to borrow additional money while leveraging your existing Home Loan, ensuring a cost-effective and convenient borrowing experience.Application process for a Top-up LoanApplying for a Top-Up Loan is simple and fast. You can apply online by providing basic details, reviewing available Loan offers, confirming the information and uploading the required documents. This process helps you receive provisional approval quickly, giving you an easy pathway to access the funds you need.Tenure for a Top-up LoanThe tenure for a Top-Up Loan depends on factors like the duration of your existing Home Loan and your eligibility. A longer tenure allows for manageable monthly payments, offering you flexibility and convenience when repaying the Loan over time.How to Get Maximum Benefits?Use Funds for Multiple PurposesApply for a Top-Up Home Loan to meet needs like home renovation, redoing interiors, etc.Leverage Overdraft FacilityCombine your Top-Up Loan with an overdraft facility for added financial flexibility and quick access to funds.Long Repayment TenureGet the benefit of a flexible and long tenure. This way, you can choose a tenure that suits your budget.No Need for Additional CollateralThe loan is offered against your existing Home Loan, so no new collateral is required. This way, you get the Loan easily without pledging any more assets.Quick ProcessingFast approval and disbursal without delays.Things You Should KnowExisting Home LoanAdd more value to your existing Home Loan with ICICI Bank.Loan AmountThe maximum amount that can be availed is up to 100% of the sanctioned amount of the original Home Loan.UsageUse the Loan for various purposes, including renovating your home, modernising the interiors, etc.Attractive Interest RatesGet an attractive rate of interest on the Top-Up Loan to save on your repayments.Things You’ll Needto ApplyTo get the Loan, you need to offer a set of common documents, which can differ for salaried and self-employed individuals.Identity ProofAddress ProofIncome ProofExisting Home Loan DocumentsHow to Apply HomeLoan Top-UpEnter basic details and loan needs.Review your loan offer.Confirm details and pay fees.Upload the required documents.Get provisional approval.APPLY NOWLooking for Something Else?ProductsInstant Home LoanInstant sanction with special processing feesInstant Balance TransferInstant sanction with minimal documentation24-hour Top-up LoanGet quick access to funds with minimal documentationHome Loan Top Up FAQ’sWhat are Top-up Loans?A Top-Up Loan is an additional Loan that you can get over your existing Home Loan to meet various financial needs.How much Top-up Home Loan can I get?You can avail up to 100% of your original Loan amount, depending on your eligibility and the value of your existing Home Loan.Can I borrow more money on an existing Home Loan?Yes, you can borrow additional funds through a Top-Up Loan on your existing Home Loan.What is the tenure for a Top-up Loan?The tenure for a Top-Up Loan can be up to 20 years, depending on your existing Home Loan tenure.How can I apply for a Top-up Loan?To apply, fill out your details, check the Loan offer, submit documents and get provisional approval for quick disbursement.Is it good to avail of a Top-up Loan on a Home Loan?Yes. It is a good option to take a Top-up Loan on aHome Loan, as it is easily available at a better rate of interest and long tenure as compared with the other options.Blogs and VideosBlogsgoto previous cardgoto next cardgoto previous cardgoto next cardCloseclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: 24-Hour Home Loan Top-Up | Disbursement in 24 Hrs at ICICI Bank
content: 24-Hour Home Loan Top-Up | Disbursement in 24 Hrs at ICICI BankLoansHome LoanTop-up Loan24 Hours Top Up LoanBenefits of the 24-Hour Top-Up LoanNeed urgent funds for home renovation or personal needs? Get a 24-Hour Top-Up Loan on your existing ICICI Bank Mortgage Loan with instant sanction, minimal paperwork and quick disbursal directly to your account.Apply NowHow to get maximum benefits?Instant Sanction with Minimal documentationQuick disbursal within 24 hours*Funds can be used for various needs such as home renovationNo fresh property documents neededAttractive interest ratesThings you should knowEligibilityOnly for existing ICICI Bank Mortgage Loan customers with a good repayment recordUsageFunds must be used for permitted personal needs like education, home renovation, medical emergencies, etc.DisbursalLoan amount is credited within 24 hours*, subject to successful verificationDocumentationMinimal documentation; No KYC documents requiredChargesProcessing fees and taxes as applicablePrepaymentPrepayment or foreclosure is subject to applicable fees and charges. Visit  Service Charges toknow moreVIEW DETAILED DOCUMENTATIONHow to Get a 24-Hour Top-Up LoanLog in as an existing customer on Express Home LoansCheck your loan detailsSubmit your application and download sanction letterAPPLY NOWFAQsWho can apply for the 24-Hour Top-Up Loan?Only existing ICICI Bank Mortgage Loan customers with good repayment records are eligible.How will I receive the loan amount?The amount will be directly credited to your loan repayment account via NEFT/RTGS/Fund Transfer.Is there a limit to how much I can borrow?Yes, the loan amount depends on your current outstanding loan, repayment history, and bank eligibility criteria.What can the Top-Up Loan be used for?The loan can be used for home renovation, medical expenses, education, wedding, travel, or any other personal requirement.Is income proof required for this Top-Up?In most cases, no fresh income documents are needed if you have a good repayment track record.close disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

your Loan early.Home Loan Document Required & EligibilityBelow is the list of documents required for a Home LoanIdentity ProofAddress ProofIncome ProofDisclaimer This is an indicative list only. Additional documents may be required for a case-to-case basis.VIEW DETAILED DOCUMENTATIONHow to Apply for Home Loan in few stepsEnter your detailsCheck your eligibilityPay the processing feeUpload DocumentsGet Provisional SanctionAPPLY NOWLooking for something else?Instant Home LoanInstant sanction with special processing fees.Instant Balance TransferInstant sanction with minimal documentation.About Home loansUnderstanding a Home LoanA Home Loan is a financial product that helps individuals purchase, build or renovate their homes. It provides funds based on the property value and the applicant’s eligibility. The Loan is typically repaid in easy monthly instalments (EMIs) over a long tenure.Benefits of a Home LoanHome Loans offer significant advantages, such as attractive interest rates, tax benefits under Section 80C and the ability to own a property without full upfront payment. They provide flexible repayment options, making it easier to manage finances. With a Home Loan, buying a home becomes more affordable and feasible.Are Home Loans a good option to buy property?Home Loans make it easier to invest in real estate, allowing individuals to purchase their dream home without having to save for and pay the entire price upfront. With attractive interest rates and long repayment periods, Home Loans ensure that buying a home is more accessible, affordable and financially manageable.Home Loan FAQsWhat is a home loan?A Home Loan provides funds for purchasing, constructing or renovating a property, which is repaid in monthly instalments over time (known as EMIs).How do I apply for a home loan?You can apply via the iMobile app, Internet Banking, the ICICI Bank website or by visiting any ICICI Bank Branch..What factors affect Home Loan eligibility?Eligibility is based on age (20–65 years for salaried individuals, 21–70 years for self-employed individuals), income, employment stability and credit score (ideally 750+) of the applicant.Take a word from our CustomersPPeddintli Rao Dodda4.5I want to express my sincere appreciation for the Relationship Manager who assisted me with my Home Loan application. His follow-up and guidance was instrumental in making the loan process fast and efficient. It took less than two days for the sanction. The disbursement was quick, covering the legal and technical aspects which is not possible with other banks. Thank you for such dedicated support and exceptional service.AAbhishek Gupta5I availed Home Loan from ICICI Bank and I will highly recommend it. The application process was simple, documentation requirements were clear and the Bank's team was responsive and professional. The loan approval and disbursal were on time and the transparency of the terms and conditions was commendable. Overall, I had a hassle-free and satisfying experience with ICICI Bank Home Loan team. I am grateful for the support and assistance I have received from the dedicated team of ICICI Bank. I am looking forward to a long and trusted relationship with ICICI Bank.SSuraj Srivastava4.5ICICI Bank and its Relationship Manager made my Home Loan process as simple as it could be. It just took 3 weeks right from the first enquiry call to the loan disbursement. Hats off to the team for their prompt actions, timely reminders for documents, closure of tasks etc. I will share my wonderful experience with others and strongly recommend ICICI Bank Home Loan to everyone. Thanks team.close disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI Bank
content: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI BankLoansHome LoanService ChargesFees And Service ChargesICICI Bank ensures that you get the best Loans in terms ofinterest ratesand other facilities. You can choose from Adjustable, Fixed or Floating Rate Loan.SMS HOME TO 5676766APPLY NOWChargesMortgage LoansLoan Processing Charges (Non Refundable)Upto 2% of loan amount.The processing/login fee is a one-timenon refundablefee and is collected by the Bank for the purpose of appraising the Application for the Facility and the same is independent of the outcome/result of such appraisal. The processing/login fee is payable at the time of submitting of the Application, by way of Cheque/Demand Draft favoring the Bank and/or such other mode as may be acceptable to the Bank.Administrative Charges0.25 % of Facility Amount or ₹ 5000/- whichever is lower.(The Administrative charges are a one-timenon-refundablecharges collected by the Lender for the purpose of appraising the valuation and legal verification of property to ascertain suitability of accepting the property for mortgage and the same is independent of the outcome /result of such appraisal. Please note that the administrative charges are payable at the time of disbursement of the Facility)Commitment charges / Non utilisation fee (Applicable for Overdraft Facility)Minimum 30% utilization required on a quarterly average basis. Charge of 0.5% will be levied on the deficit amount*.* Not applicable for salaried customersPart Prepayment FeesNilPrepayment Charges1. For the Facility with Fixed Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:2% on Home loan, Home improvement loan, Land loan and Top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.4% on Non-home loan (i.e. Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards Prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.Nil Prepayment charges on fixed rate loans if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Small or Micro & Loan amount is less than or equal to ₹ 50 lacs.2. For the Facility with Adjustable Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:Nil prepayment charges on home loan, home improvement loan and land loanNil prepayment charges on top up on home loan where the Borrower(s) is individual and the end use of the loan facility is other than business purpose.2% on top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to Non-Individual Borrower(s) for all-purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Non-home loan (Loan against property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance , Overdraft) where loan is given to Individual Borrower(s) and the end use of the Facility is other than business purpose.4% on Non-home loan (Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to non-individual Borrower(s) for all purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Money Saver Account.Conversion chargesFor all floating (adjustable) rate linked term loan to Fixed or floating (adjustable) ₹ 3,000.Semi Fixed / Fixed Interest Rate to Adjustable Interest Rate - 2% of the principal outstandingFor Overdraft - 0.5% of the principal outstandingCheque/ECS/NACH dishonor Charges, per transaction₹ 500/- charges per bounce/return/dishonor of cheques and /or any payment instruction including AD / ECS / NEFT / E-Cheque or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Cheque/Repayment mode swap charges₹ 500/-Penal Charges in the event of default/delay in payment/repayment of any part of the loan amount on due datePenal Charges shall be equal to 5% per annum on the overdue sum from the due date to the actual payment date plus applicable taxes or other statutory levies, if any.Charges for Amortisation Schedule₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for Statement of account₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for prepayment statement₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for duplicate NOC/No Dues Certificate₹ 250/-Charge for revalidation of no objection certificate₹ 250/-Penal charges for non-submission of the post disbursement documents₹ 5000/- per month (will be levied from the day the document is due till the same is not submitted)Penal charges for non-collection of property documents post 60 days from the loan closure date₹ 1,000/- Every month charges will be levied till collection of documents.Penal Charges for breach of construction timelineIn case of land loan, the Borrower(s) shall complete the construction of the house within 4 years. If the construction of the house is not completed within 4 years from the first disbursement date the Borrower shall be liable to pay Penal Charges as under -1% annually on the principal outstanding or ₹ 50,000/- whichever is lower or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Penal Charges will be levied every year after 4 years till the construction is completed.Renewal Fees (Applicable for Overdraft Product)₹ 5,000/-Not applicable for Money Saver and Insta OD.Loan / Property Document Retreival Charges₹ 500/-Cash Transaction Charges (for repayment of EMI due in cash at branches)₹ 100/-Information utility charges (Only for corporate cases)₹ 300/-Non-refundable charges under Central Registry of Securitization Asset Reconstruction and Security Interest of India (CERSAI)₹ 50/- (For loan upto 5L)₹ 100/- (For loan above 5L)Auction charges for repossessed assetAt ActualsCharges incurred in filing legal suitAt ActualsCharges incurred in SARFAESI proceedingsAt ActualsEnforcement chargesAt ActualsNon Maintenance of Mode of Payment charges (NMMP)₹ 800/-Paper advertisement chargesAt ActualsProfessional charges (Advocate Charges/Retainer ship Charges)At ActualsRepossession chargesAt ActualsSecurity guard chargesAt ActualsNoteGoods & Service Tax and other taxes, levies, etc. applicable as per prevailing rate will be charged over and above these chargesPlease Note:Time frame for Disposal of Loan Application Form (MSE Borrower) is as below:(from the date of receipt, provided your application is complete in all respects and is accompanied by documents as per 'check list' provided)Up to ₹ 25 lakhwithin 14 working daysAbove ₹ 25 lakhwithin 6 weeksAPPLY NOWclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Home Loan Interest Rates @7.70%* (2025) | ICICI Bank
content: Home Loan Interest Rates @7.70%* (2025) | ICICI BankLoansHome LoanInterest RateHome Loan Interest Rates - August 2025Buy your dream home with ICICI Bank's attractive Home Loan offers! Choose between floating and fixed interest rates as per your needs. Get a Home Loan up to ₹ 5 Crore* with minimal documentation and step into your new home sooner.Customers with an Instant Home Loan can get online sanction of their Home Loan at a rate of interest of 7.70%* p.a.*T&Cs apply. Rate of interest is subject to bureau score and applicable for Instant Home Loans through the digital platform / journey.APPLY NOWRepo Rate effective June 7th, 2025 – 5.50%Special Home Loan RatesGet customised Home Loan rates tailored to your credit score. Enjoy personalised lending options that fit your financial needs.Credit ScoreSalaried CustomersSelf-Employed Customers8008.75%8.75%750 – 8008.75%8.85%The above-mentioned interest rates are linked to the repo rate and will be valid till 31st August, 2025.Standard Home Loan Interest RateICICI Bank offers Home Loans with standard interest rates that cater to your financial needs. Our tiered loan slabs ensure that home financing is convenient and accessible, supporting a diverse range of borrowers.Loan SlabSalaried CustomersSelf-Employed CustomersUp to ₹ 35 lakh8.75% - 9.40%8.75% - 9.55%₹ 35 lakh to ₹ 75 lakh8.75% - 9.55%8.75% - 9.70%Above ₹ 75 lakh8.75% - 9.65%8.750% -9.80%The interest rates mentioned above for Home Loans vary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.All the interest rates mentioned above are linked to the repo rateThe processing fee is 0.5% of the loan amount + applicable taxesThe above-mentioned interest rates are valid till 31st August, 2025.Fixed Home Loan Interest RatesLooking for stability in your Home Loan payments? ICICI Bank’s fixed Home Loan interest rates offer just that. Lock in your interest rate for the entire loan tenure and enjoy predictable EMIs throughout..Fixed TenureRate of Interest24 Months Fixed8.85%37 Months Fixed8.65%-8.80%60 Months Fixed120 Months Fixed10.75%-11.80%Full Term Fixed10.90%-11.20%The interest rates mentioned above forHome Loansvary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.The interest rates for fixed home loans will be valid till 31st August, 2025.Interest Rates for Non-Housing Loans: Loan Against Property/Non-Residential Premises/Lease Rental DiscountingLoan SlabSalaried/ Self-Employed (PSL)Self-Employed (Non-PSL)Up to ₹ 50 lakh11.10%-11.75%11.60%-12.25%₹ 50 lakh to ₹ 100 lakh10.85%-11.50%11.35%-12.00%Above ₹ 100 lakh10.60%-11.25%11.10%-11.75%The interest rates mentioned above vary based on parameters such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc.All the interest rates mentioned above are linked to the repo rateThe above-mentioned interest rates are valid till 31st August, 2025.FAQs on Home Loan Interest RatesWhat is a Home Loan interest rate?The interest rate on a Home Loan is the percentage charged as interest by the lender on the total amount an individual borrows to buy or refinance a residential property.What are the current Home Loan interest rates offered by ICICI Bank?The current Home Loan interest rates offered by ICICI Bank can be checked in the table given above.How can the interest rate of a Home Loan be reduced?The interest rate of home loan depends on multiple factors such as bureau score, customer segment, customer profile etc. Customers can also compare interest rates offered by different banks and can transfer their existing loan to a favourable lender, if applicable.Which interest rate is known as the perfect option?Different types of interest rates are suitable for different customers. You can clickhereto see the various interest rates offered by ICICI Bank on Home Loans.How does the EMI for a Home Loan get calculated?The EMI of a Home Loan is calculated basis the loan amount, the applicable rate of interest and the loan duration (tenure). You can visitthispage to know more.What are the interest rates charged on the Home Loans?ICICI Bank provides competitive interest rates on Home Loans which are linked to the repo rate published by the RBI. You can check the current interest rates for Home Loans at the beginning of this page.Are there any other factors that determine the interest rates on Home Loans?Yes. Factors like credit score play a crucial role in deciding the interest rate that an individual pays on their Home Loan.How can I find out the EMI amount for a specific Home Loan?All applicants can easily find out the EMI amount by using our Home Loan EMI Calculator. To use the calculator, you must provide the interest rate, tenure and loan amount and you will be shown the interest payable and EMI amount instantly.What are the types of Home Loan interest rates?The choice of interest rate can greatly affect your home loan EMIs. Here are the two main types:1. Floating Interest Rate:This rate varies with market conditions, offering potential savings but also carries the risk of the rate being increased. This is suitable for customers who can handle uncertainty.2. Fixed Interest Rate:A fixed interest rates provides stability, ensuring consistent EMIs throughout the loan term, making budgeting easier.How are interest payments calculated?Interest payments are calculated using the below methods:1. Flat Interest Rate:Calculates interest on the full loan amount for the entire loan term, leading to higher total interest costs.2. Reducing Balance Method:Interest is calculated on the remaining principal balance. As you repay, the interest may increase or decrease, affecting the overall loan cost.What aspects can affect the rate of interest on home loans?Below are some important aspects that are considered when deciding the Home Loan interest rate:Credit Score:All lenders consider the loan applicant's credit score. People with a higher credit score are more likely to be eligible for a higher Home LoanLTV (Loan to Value) Ratio:This is the proportion of the loan amount that goes towards the home's appraised valueEconomic Conditions:Broader economic aspects such as central bank policies, market trends and inflation can impact interest ratesBorrower’s Debt-To-Income Ratio:All lenders check the borrower’s debt and income levels to determine their repayment capacity and accordingly, the interest rate.How can I save on my Home Loan interest payment?Make additional repayments:When you make extra repayments towards the principal amount, you reduce the outstanding loan amount and consequently, the interest to be paidChoose a shorter loan duration:Opting for a loan with a shorter duration (tenure) will result in higher monthly payments but lower interest payoutNegotiate with the lender:If applicable, you should negotiate with the lender to obtain a lower interest rate.How do I check the overall interest payout of the Home Loan?To calculate the overall interest payout for the Home Loan, use the online Home Loan Calculator offered by ICICI Bank.  Provide the tenure, interest rate and loan amount to check the interest you must pay during the loan term.What are the various kinds of interest rates for housing loans?ICICI Bank provides interest rates on housing loans that are classified as ‘fixed’, ‘standard’, and ‘special’. The fixed option guarantees that the interest rate will stay constant throughout the loan duration.close disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

title: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI Bank
content: Home Loan Service Charges and Processing Fees at ICICI BankLoansHome LoanService ChargesFees And Service ChargesICICI Bank ensures that you get the best Loans in terms ofinterest ratesand other facilities. You can choose from Adjustable, Fixed or Floating Rate Loan.SMS HOME TO 5676766APPLY NOWChargesMortgage LoansLoan Processing Charges (Non Refundable)Upto 2% of loan amount.The processing/login fee is a one-timenon refundablefee and is collected by the Bank for the purpose of appraising the Application for the Facility and the same is independent of the outcome/result of such appraisal. The processing/login fee is payable at the time of submitting of the Application, by way of Cheque/Demand Draft favoring the Bank and/or such other mode as may be acceptable to the Bank.Administrative Charges0.25 % of Facility Amount or ₹ 5000/- whichever is lower.(The Administrative charges are a one-timenon-refundablecharges collected by the Lender for the purpose of appraising the valuation and legal verification of property to ascertain suitability of accepting the property for mortgage and the same is independent of the outcome /result of such appraisal. Please note that the administrative charges are payable at the time of disbursement of the Facility)Commitment charges / Non utilisation fee (Applicable for Overdraft Facility)Minimum 30% utilization required on a quarterly average basis. Charge of 0.5% will be levied on the deficit amount*.* Not applicable for salaried customersPart Prepayment FeesNilPrepayment Charges1. For the Facility with Fixed Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:2% on Home loan, Home improvement loan, Land loan and Top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.4% on Non-home loan (i.e. Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards Prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment.Nil Prepayment charges on fixed rate loans if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Small or Micro & Loan amount is less than or equal to ₹ 50 lacs.2. For the Facility with Adjustable Interest Rate at the time of prepayment:Nil prepayment charges on home loan, home improvement loan and land loanNil prepayment charges on top up on home loan where the Borrower(s) is individual and the end use of the loan facility is other than business purpose.2% on top up on home loan on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to Non-Individual Borrower(s) for all-purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Non-home loan (Loan against property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance , Overdraft) where loan is given to Individual Borrower(s) and the end use of the Facility is other than business purpose.4% on Non-home loan (Loan Against Property, Non Residential Premises, Lease Rental Discounting, Non Home Loan Top Up, Retail Trade Finance, Overdraft) on amount prepaid and on all amounts tendered by the Borrower(s) towards prepayment of the Facility during the last one year from the date of final prepayment where the loan is given to individual Borrower(s) for business purpose and to non-individual Borrower(s) for all purpose. Nil prepayment charges will be applicable to individual Borrower(s) if loan is booked under priority sector lending and Borrower(s) type is Micro or Small Enterprise.Nil prepayment charges on Money Saver Account.Conversion chargesFor all floating (adjustable) rate linked term loan to Fixed or floating (adjustable) ₹ 3,000.Semi Fixed / Fixed Interest Rate to Adjustable Interest Rate - 2% of the principal outstandingFor Overdraft - 0.5% of the principal outstandingCheque/ECS/NACH dishonor Charges, per transaction₹ 500/- charges per bounce/return/dishonor of cheques and /or any payment instruction including AD / ECS / NEFT / E-Cheque or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Cheque/Repayment mode swap charges₹ 500/-Penal Charges in the event of default/delay in payment/repayment of any part of the loan amount on due datePenal Charges shall be equal to 5% per annum on the overdue sum from the due date to the actual payment date plus applicable taxes or other statutory levies, if any.Charges for Amortisation Schedule₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for Statement of account₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for prepayment statement₹ 200/- for physical print out at the branchCharges for duplicate NOC/No Dues Certificate₹ 250/-Charge for revalidation of no objection certificate₹ 250/-Penal charges for non-submission of the post disbursement documents₹ 5000/- per month (will be levied from the day the document is due till the same is not submitted)Penal charges for non-collection of property documents post 60 days from the loan closure date₹ 1,000/- Every month charges will be levied till collection of documents.Penal Charges for breach of construction timelineIn case of land loan, the Borrower(s) shall complete the construction of the house within 4 years. If the construction of the house is not completed within 4 years from the first disbursement date the Borrower shall be liable to pay Penal Charges as under -1% annually on the principal outstanding or ₹ 50,000/- whichever is lower or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Penal Charges will be levied every year after 4 years till the construction is completed.Renewal Fees (Applicable for Overdraft Product)₹ 5,000/-Not applicable for Money Saver and Insta OD.Loan / Property Document Retreival Charges₹ 500/-Cash Transaction Charges (for repayment of EMI due in cash at branches)₹ 100/-Information utility charges (Only for corporate cases)₹ 300/-Non-refundable charges under Central Registry of Securitization Asset Reconstruction and Security Interest of India (CERSAI)₹ 50/- (For loan upto 5L)₹ 100/- (For loan above 5L)Auction charges for repossessed assetAt ActualsCharges incurred in filing legal suitAt ActualsCharges incurred in SARFAESI proceedingsAt ActualsEnforcement chargesAt ActualsNon Maintenance of Mode of Payment charges (NMMP)₹ 800/-Paper advertisement chargesAt ActualsProfessional charges (Advocate Charges/Retainer ship Charges)At ActualsRepossession chargesAt ActualsSecurity guard chargesAt ActualsNoteGoods & Service Tax and other taxes, levies, etc. applicable as per prevailing rate will be charged over and above these chargesPlease Note:Time frame for Disposal of Loan Application Form (MSE Borrower) is as below:(from the date of receipt, provided your application is complete in all respects and is accompanied by documents as per 'check list' provided)Up to ₹ 25 lakhwithin 14 working daysAbove ₹ 25 lakhwithin 6 weeksAPPLY NOWclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

If the construction of the house is not completed within 4 years from the first disbursement date the Borrower shall be liable to pay Penal Charges as under -1% annually on the principal outstanding or ₹ 50,000/- whichever is lower or such other amount as may be specified by the Bank from time to time and it shall be levied as per the discretion of the Bank.Penal Charges will be levied every year after 4 years till the construction is completed.Renewal Fees (Applicable for Overdraft Product)₹ 5,000/-Not applicable for Money Saver and Insta OD.Loan / Property Document Retreival Charges₹ 500/-Cash Transaction Charges (for repayment of EMI due in cash at branches)₹ 100/-Information utility charges (Only for corporate cases)₹ 300/-Non-refundable charges under Central Registry of Securitization Asset Reconstruction and Security Interest of India (CERSAI)₹ 50/- (For loan upto 5L)₹ 100/- (For loan above 5L)Auction charges for repossessed assetAt ActualsCharges incurred in filing legal suitAt ActualsCharges incurred in SARFAESI proceedingsAt ActualsEnforcement chargesAt ActualsNon Maintenance of Mode of Payment charges (NMMP)₹ 800/-Paper advertisement chargesAt ActualsProfessional charges (Advocate Charges/Retainer ship Charges)At ActualsRepossession chargesAt ActualsSecurity guard chargesAt ActualsNoteGoods & Service Tax and other taxes, levies, etc. applicable as per prevailing rate will be charged over and above these chargesPlease Note:Time frame for Disposal of Loan Application Form (MSE Borrower) is as below:(from the date of receipt, provided your application is complete in all respects and is accompanied by documents as per 'check list' provided)Up to ₹ 25 lakhwithin 14 working daysAbove ₹ 25 lakhwithin 6 weeksAPPLY NOWclose disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED

The list of required documents will vary accordingly. These are the mandatory documentsIncome ProofIdentity proofAddress proofApplication formLatest PhotographsVIEW DETAILED DOCUMENTATIONLooking for something else?ProductsInstant Home LoanInstant sanction with special processing feeInstant Balance TransferInstant sanction, minimal documentationInstant Top UpQuick financial solution in a few clicksAbout Pratham Home LoanPratham Home Loan OverviewPratham Home Loan is an affordable Home Loan designed for salaried and self-employed individuals, helping them purchase their dream home with flexible repayment options and attractive interest rates. It offers easy documentation and quick approvals for a hassle-free borrowing experience.Eligibility CriteriaApplicants must be at least 21 years old to apply. Loan approval depends on various factors, including income, employment status, credit history, and financial stability. ICICI Bank evaluates these criteria to determine the suitable loan amount and repayment terms.Loan Amount & TenureBorrowers can avail of a Home Loan of up to Rs. 50 Lakh with a repayment tenure of up to 20 years. This allows for manageable EMIs, making homeownership more affordable while ensuring long-term financial stability.Balance Transfer FacilityICICI Bank offers a balance transfer option, allowing borrowers to shift their existing Home Loan from other banks or financial institutions to ICICI Bank. This facility helps in securing attractive interest rates and reducing overall financial burdenFAQsWho can apply for Pratham Home Loans?Salaried employees with a minimum salary of Rs. 10,000/month and self-employed individuals with 5   years of business experience and 3 years if in the same line of business are eligible.What can I use Pratham Home Loans for?You can use it for Home Loans, Home Improvement Loans, Non-Residential Premises Loans, Balance Transfers, Land +construction loans funded under EMI under constructionWhat is the loan limit for Pratham Home Loans?Pratham Home Loans offer loan amounts between Rs. 5 Lakh and Rs. 50 Lakh.How do I apply for a Pratham Home Loan?Apply online via ICICI Bank’s website or app, or visit a branch.What are the eligibility criteria?You must be at least 21 years old, with a minimum monthly salary of  Rs. 10,000, with a minimum of 1 year of work experience, and a minimum of 6 months of work experience in the current organisation for salaried individuals, and a  5 year business vintage or 3 years if same line of business for self-employed.BlogsBlogsgoto previous cardgoto next cardgoto previous cardgoto next cardCloseTake a word from our CustomersPPeddintli Rao Dodda4.5I want to express my sincere appreciation for the Relationship Manager who assisted me with my Home Loan application. His follow-up and guidance was instrumental in making the loan process fast and efficient. It took less than two days for the sanction. The disbursement was quick, covering the legal and technical aspects which is not possible with other banks. Thank you for such dedicated support and exceptional service.AAbhishek Gupta5I availed Home Loan from ICICI Bank and I will highly recommend it. The application process was simple, documentation requirements were clear and the Bank's team was responsive and professional. The loan approval and disbursal were on time and the transparency of the terms and conditions was commendable. Overall, I had a hassle-free and satisfying experience with ICICI Bank Home Loan team. I am grateful for the support and assistance I have received from the dedicated team of ICICI Bank. I am looking forward to a long and trusted relationship with ICICI Bank.SSuraj Srivastava4.5ICICI Bank and its Relationship Manager made my Home Loan process as simple as it could be. It just took 3 weeks right from the first enquiry call to the loan disbursement. Hats off to the team for their prompt actions, timely reminders for documents, closure of tasks etc. I will share my wonderful experience with others and strongly recommend ICICI Bank Home Loan to everyone. Thanks team.close disclaimer modalDisclaimerSTAY ON THIS SITEPROCEED
